column7: Job Brief This position is eligible for our Crane Flex Hybrid schedule which allows for the option of up to 2 days/week of work-from-home.Crane Aerospace & Electronics is seeking a Test Engineer III - Contractor in Burbank, CA, on a part-time basis, for a 6-month contract. Job Summary: The Test Engineer performs major Qualification Engineering activities. Interacts with other engineering groups to define, document, analyze, perform, and interpret tests for products, systems and components. Identifies functional problems, troubleshoots and suggests resolutions. Analyzes test cases and provides regular progress reports. This position is eligible for our Crane Flex Hybrid schedule which allows for the option of up to 2 days/week of work-from-home. Some conditions apply which will be discussed during the interview process. Full policy to be provided after hire. Essential Functions:Collaborate with customers and engineers to establish/clarify test, qualification, verification and validation requirements. Write test plans, procedures and reports for testing based on standards such as MIL-810, MIL-704, and DO-16.Participate in the estimation of costs and schedules to develop or upgrade test platforms.Perform detailed calculations to establish test equipment specifications and design margins.Work independently under minimal supervision and guidance to perform tasks of substantial complexity and to be capable of leading and coordinating the efforts of junior engineers.Design, fabrication, standardization and documentation of EMC Test Fixtures.Minimum Qualifications:Minimum BS degree in Electrical Engineering or other related Science/Engineering field, or equivalent work experience.Minimum of 7 years working experience with developing and testing electronic assemblies, preferably in an engineering environment.Good verbal and written communication skills.Familiar with desktop computer applications such as Microsoft EXCEL, WORD, Outlook e-mail, and Internet Explorer applications.Ability to logically solve problems, organize materials, and keep projects moving in an orderly and structured fashion.Ability to work well with others in the areas of teamwork and communication.Expert in troubleshooting related to failures during EMC testing of electronic HW design and at system test level.Expert with planning, executing, and reporting on EMI testing in accordance with MIL-STD-461/462 and RTCA/DO-160 test standards.Familiar with planning, executing, and reporting on environmental testing (e.g. altitude, humidity, temperature, vibration, etc.) testing in accordance with MIL-STD-810 and RTCA/DO-160 test standards.Familiar with planning, executing, and reporting on electrical power quality testing in accordance with MIL-STD-704 and RTCA/DO-160 test standards.Familiar with planning, executing, and reporting on lighting inducted transient testing in accordance with MIL-STD-464, RTCA/DO-160, and SAE ARP5412 test standardsEligibility Requirement: This position may require access to Controlled Data or Information. Where the position requires such access only US persons will be considered. As a US Department of Defense contractor, we are bound by International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR).Preferred Qualifications:Experience working for an aerospace or equivalent company with regard to the rigor of software creation and hardware design with emphasis on safety About Crane: Crane Aerospace & Electronics supplies critical systems and components to the aerospace and defense markets. You will find Crane Aerospace & Electronics in some of the toughest environments: from engines to landing gear; from satellites to medical implants and from missiles to unmanned aerial systems (UAS). We are committed to operational excellence and world-class processes. We employ Lean manufacturing techniques to optimize manufacturing efficiency and accuracy on all product lines. Our products are known for their technical strength, proven reliability and overall value. Hourly Range: $55.00 - $63.00. Several factors contribute to actual salary, including experience in a similar role or performing comparable job responsibilities, skills, training, and other qualifications. Compensation packages also include comprehensive benefits, 401K contribution and match, Paid Time Off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement and more. Some roles may be eligible for participation in performance-based bonus programs. You can see a list of our benefits at https://www.craneae.com/company/careers or visit our website at www.CraneAE.com for more information on our company and great opportunities In our efforts to maintain a safe and drug-free workplace, Crane Aerospace & Electronics requires that candidates complete a satisfactory background check. FAA sensitive positions require employees to participate in a random drug test pool. This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work being performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Crane Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, genetic information, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law. #LI-NT1 #CAE

Requisition ID: R10129067 Category: Engineering Location: Melbourne, Florida, United States of America Citizenship required: United States Citizenship Clearance Type: SAP Telecommute: No- Teleworking not available for this position Shift: 1st Shift (United States of America) Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Assistance: Relocation assistance may be available Positions Available: 1   At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.  Join Northrop Grumman on our continued mission to push the boundaries of possible across land, sea, air, space, and cyberspace. Enjoy a culture where your voice is valued and start contributing to our team of passionate professionals providing real-life solutions to our world’s biggest challenges. We take pride in creating purposeful work and allowing our employees to grow and achieve their goals every day by Defining Possible. With our competitive pay and comprehensive benefits, we have the right opportunities to fit your life and launch your career today. Northrop Grumman Aeronautics Systems Sector has an opening for a Staff Engineer specializing in Dimensional Engineering to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals within our Vehicle Engineering organization. The qualified applicant will become part of Northrop Grumman's Digital Transformation team working in a collaborative environment while promoting a positive and proactive teamwork environment. This position is located in Melbourne, Florida. The Dimensional Engineer shall serve the sector as the accountable custodian for all aspects of the dimensional configuration of our vehicle platforms. Through utilization of 1D / 2D stack up analysis and 3D model-based variation analysis tools, they will be responsible for development and implementation of various dimensional control strategies to reduce, manage, and absorb vehicle assembly variation throughout the entire build process. As a subject-matter expert in Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T), the Dimensional Engineer shall support all design activities as needed to ensure our designers are executing on these strategies through proper communication of dimensioning and tolerancing per ASME Y14.5 and related industry standards. Key Responsibilities: The Dimensional Engineer shall provide guidance to Production Operations and Design IPTs, challenging traditional methods when appropriate for the purpose of improving repeatability, optimizing for build variation, and reducing build costs. The Dimensional Engineer shall be responsible for supporting advanced Building Block (manufacturing test article) activities to analyze and validate metrology data, participate in problem resolution, and confirm that proposed dimensional control strategies are meeting program objectives. The Dimensional Engineer will help their team to develop/document best practices, mentor individuals in the analysis process and tool suite, and interface with program leadership across multiple programs to further the development of the Dimensional Engineering Team (DET) organization. Upon request, the Dimensional Engineer shall provide relevant course instruction across a multitude of technical disciplines. They may be tasked with producing various forms of Dimensional Engineering best-practice documentation to flow out to the Design and Manufacturing communities - across a particular program, an entire sector, or the enterprise at large - to advance the utilization and development of the Dimensional Engineering organization. We offer flexible work arrangements, 9/80 work schedule with every other Friday off, phenomenal learning opportunities, exposure to a wide variety of projects and customers, and a very friendly team environment. We are looking for self-motivated, proactive, and goal-oriented people to help us grow our services and become even better at what we do. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor of Science degree in a STEM discipline (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math) and 14 years of related experience to include a background in OR Master’s degree in a STEM discipline and 12 years of related experience to include a background in. Experience with GD&T and familiarity with detail/assembly detuning best practices. Experience in performing tolerance stack-up analysis on production scale assemblies. Knowledge of statistical qualification of machinery, equipment, and gages. Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret clearance. Must have the ability to obtain and maintain Special Access Program (SAP) clearance. Preferred Qualifications: Active DoD Secret (or higher) clearance (with a background investigation within the past 6 years or enrolled into Continuous Evaluation). Current Special Program Access. Experience working in an aerospace design environment. Emphasis placed in the following disciplines: Structural Design/Analysis, Subsystems Design/Analysis, Electrical/Mechanical Routing, or Mechanism Design/Analysis. In-depth knowledge of GD&T and application of ASME Y14.5-2009. ASME Y14.5 GDTP 2009 Senior-Certification. Experience working with Teamcenter and NX (or equivalent PDM/PLM and CAD/CAE applications). Proficiency in Siemens Vis-VSA and/or 3DCS Variation Analysis software (including FEA) Experience reviewing and interpreting engineering model-based definition. Ability to document and maintain process methods. Ability to interface/communicate with multiple levels of leadership, clients, and vendors. Lean, Six Sigma, 5S knowledge Salary Range: $126,100 - $189,100     Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.  Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Test Engineer III - Contractor: Design Release Engineer – Passive Safety Electronics
column7: ABOUT Re:Car Re:Car, a subsidiary of Re:Build Manufacturing, is a new company that is exploring development in the electric vehicle space. Who we are looking for Re:Car is looking for an energetic, organized, experienced Design Release Engineer – Passive Safety Electronics - to join our growing team. Re:Car is a new US Electric Vehicle company transforming the battery electric vehicle space. Our technology is designed to deliver the most reliable and most efficient low cost of ownership electric vehicle on the market. What you get to do The DRE will lead the engineering and Tier 1 suppliers for the passive safety electronics supporting the content listed in the Program Description Letter. This Engineer will report to the Lead – Restraints Systems Engineering manager and will be responsible for driving the development of the restraints system components of the Re:Car battery electric vehicles. The engineer will be challenged to develop unique solutions for various applications throughout the vehicle. This candidate will have responsibility to manage tier 1 supplier engineers, external resources and collaborate across the vehicle component areas as needed to optimize application solutions. Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:Develop functional requirements for each system and component for the ACU – Airbag Control Unit Module & SensorsDevelop technical requirements for the systems and components in collaboration with internal functions, design studio, engineering and Teir 1 suppliers.Lead/Support the design, development, release and certification of the systems and components with product development tools – CAE, CAD, BOM, Drawing Release, Software Release, DFMEAs, DVP&Rs, Attribute Validation, Vehicle Testing, Component Testing, and Certification Reporting for all regulatory requirements.Meet all timing, quality and cost requirements.What you bring to the TeamBachelor Degree in Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent from an ABET accredited or equivalent program is preferred. Master in Engineering preferred.8+ years of Design Release Engineering in Restraints and/or Safety ElectronicsExperience and knowledge of the vehicle level safety development processExcellent communication Team building and relationship building skills.Ability to lead teams and Tier 1 suppliers and integrate and drive technical tradeoffs and optimized solutions with attention to detail, with all functions as needed.Direct working experience with NHTSA/FMVSS, NCAP, and IIHS Crash Requirements.Ability and Desire to build your own team and work in a fun and fast paced environment.We want to work with people that reflect the communities in which we operate Re:Build Manufacturing is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, marital status, parental status, cultural background, organizational level, work styles, tenure and life experiences. Or for any other reason. Re:Build is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations.ta@ReBuildmanufacturing.com or you may call us at 617.909.6275.

Test Engineer III - Contractor: Sr. Engineer, Electric Motor & BEV Simulation
column7: Tula is driven by an overriding passion to increase efficiency and improve the environment. With more than 340 patents issued or pending for multiple technologies, and a combined 450 years of engineering behind those patents, we’re focused primarily on applications for passenger automobiles, commercial vehicles for on and off road and electric vehicles of any size. Our approach to improving efficiency sets us apart. We come at it with demonstrated software solutions, and we deliver proven results with more than one million vehicles on the road using our technologies to decrease greenhouse gas emissions and increase fuel savings. But we’re not stopping there. We’re working to reduce or eliminate the use of rare earth elements in electric vehicles through improved electric motor efficiency and exploring efficiency in other means of mobility, too, including robotics, e-aviation and industrial machinery. Tula drives efficiency. The Senior Engineer, Electric Motor and BEV Simulation will be a core member of the team developing advanced motor control strategies at Tula. They will work closely with cross-functional team members on both customer and internal development programs focusing on advanced electric motor and BEV applications to meet challenging performance targets. Primary responsibilities include: Develop and validate simulation models for electric motors, inverters, batteries, and BEV powertrainsCarefully create simulation and experimental test plans to support identification of key static and dynamic characteristics of electric motor and powertrain systemsConduct detailed analysis of simulation and test results to draw strong conclusions about operating characteristics and to evaluate proposed algorithms with respect to stringent targets for energy efficiency, drivability and NVHEnhance analytical practices to improve model accuracy and/or increase execution speedUtilize simulation models to develop system-level optimization strategies and algorithmsCoordinate closely with the electric motor, vehicle, and battery Test and Algorithms teams, utilizing vendors and contractors as neededDevelop project plans and contribute to the generation of innovative ideas Requirements MS in electrical or mechanical engineering, or equivalent technical backgroundMature understanding of electric motor and BEV powertrain design principles and R&D methodologyStrong analysis skills for predicting and verifying energy efficiency, drivability and NVHDemonstrated experience with CAE tools such as JMAG, Ansys Maxwell, or Motor-CAD and associated model correlation and validation methodologiesKnowledge of electric motor and vehicle instrumentation, data acquisition and experiment designSystematic approach toward engineering developmentEffective verbal and written communication skills including the ability to influence technical directionDemonstrated team orientation and project management skillsAbility to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced start-up environment Salary Range: $132,000 – 195,000 + benefits and stock options (actual compensation will be determined based on experience level). Flexible work from home options available.

Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility   At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.    We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.    Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.  Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates should have demonstrated the ability to learn quickly and work effectively in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment and be excellent at multi-tasking The Role: Create and develop innovative Body in White (BIW) components in aluminum and/or steel to achieve best-in-class vehicle systems, Noise Vibration Harshness (NVH) and crash performance Work closely with CAE teams interpreting and using analysis results to guide and evolve the design Work with manufacturing to ensure efficient buildable designs Work efficiently within a multidisciplinary cooperative environment Qualifications: Expertise in vehicle bodyshell design engineering Ability to develop design concepts and production designs in CATIA V5/6 Knowledge and ability to integrate state-of-the-art design and manufacturing methods into product concepts and designs including familiarity with GD&T and dimensional engineering Working knowledge of Aluminum structure joining techniques Proof of excellence in your past position, while demonstrating profound creativity in resolving mechanical design problems Experience in full life cycle, from concept to prototype to full production Education: Bachelor's in Mechanical Engineering or higher Preferred: Experience with composites Experience with GD&T Fabrication experience Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors.  California (Bay Area) - $115,000-$165,000 Additional Compensation and Benefits: Lucid offers a wide range of competitive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, vacation, and 401k. The successful candidate may also be eligible to participate in Lucid’s equity program and/or a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing such programs. (Cash or equity incentive awards, if any, will depend on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and company performance.)  Lucid maintains your privacy according to its Candidate Privacy Notice. If you are a California resident, please refer to our California Candidate Privacy Notice. Resodyn is located in Southwest Montana. An excellent career and lifestyle opportunity for the correct individual exists to design state-of-the-art technologies having both near-term and future commercial potential.The Opportunity:Resodyn is a successful, growing, dynamic, new product development and manufacturing company that designs advanced technologies for mixing and processing solutions supporting a broad range of industries and applications.The unique mixing system that Resodyn has patented is called Resonant Acoustic Mixing and is capable of mixing all combinations of solids, liquids, and gases using high-intensity, low-frequency acoustic energy. These high-tech mixing systems are marketed and sold globally to an expanding list of clients. well as new and complex commercial products.Develop and complete product designs as an effective team member and/or individually as assigned by management.Strong CAD and CAE design and analysis Description:   Bollinger Motors is seeking a Sr. Vehicle Test Engineer who will be responsible for designing vehicle level test procedures and creating judgment criteria to assess test results in order to validate vehicle design requirements. This position requires a talented engineer with passion for and experience with electric vehicles in a practical, multidisciplinary environment. This position reports to Vehicle Test Engineering Manager. This is an in-person role at the company’s Oak Park, MI headquarters. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Design and conduct durability and reliability tests to assess the long-term reliability and robustness of vehicle components, including chassis, suspension, and powertrain systems. Design test procedures and judgment criteria to assess vehicle and system performance against design requirements. Design and conduct specialized tests tailored to assess specific vehicle systems such as thermal performance tests, vibration tests, strength and abuse tests, etc. Plan and execute vehicle level dynamic and static test activities per test plans developed in collaboration with key stakeholders. Instrumentation of test articles including installation of thermocouples (Type J, K and T), video cameras, strain gauges, accelerometers, load transducers, etc. Be responsible for retrieving, storing and analyzing logged data from tests and comparing design specifications. Write detailed test reports recording subjective and objective findings and any issues. Manage all open Issues discovered on test with the responsible Design Engineers until a design countermeasure is achieved and plan for validation by retest, CAE simulation, or other means to close out open issues. Manage test cost, schedule, scope, and risk throughout the program lifecycle and maintain critical path timing. Provide input and engineering analysis to development teams. Work efficiently and in close collaboration with hardware, software, and testing teams. Requirements:  We are focused on building a great team and beyond the technical skills, we require humility and teamwork. We expect to work in the office full-time, and we are a dog friendly company. Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, automotive engineering or related field. 5+ years in a similar role in the automotive or electric vehicle industry. Experience running and maintaining a variety of vehicle level tests including Structural Durability, Corrosion, Reliability, Strength & Abuse, Water Fording, Coast Down etc. Proficiency in using specialized testing equipment, data acquisition systems, and analysis software including accelerometers, strain gauges, wheel force transducers, Vector CAN tools, etc. Proving ground and on-road / on-track experience preferred. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with internal teams and external stakeholders. Willing to travel up to 20% of the time. ***No Third Parties*** At Bollinger Motors, Inc., we celebrate the unique differences of our employees and recognize a diverse and inclusive workforce drives curiosity, innovation, and ultimately the success of our business. We are committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination and provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age, disability, arrest record, genetic information (including family medical history), marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law. Bollinger Motors complies with applicable federal, state, and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruitment, hiring, placement, compensation, promotion, discipline, and termination. Whenever possible, Bollinger Motors will provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees who need them due to religious beliefs, disabilities, or medical conditions.

We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.    Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.  As a Senior Mechanical Engineer in the Chassis team, you will help design and deliver world-leading suspension architectures for our electric vehicle platforms. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches their work with vigor and determination.  Role: Manage multiple complex projects in a demanding environment Deliver engineering concepts aligned with vehicle and chassis targets and assess full vehicle trade-offs. Lead teams in solving complex packaging Collaborate with engineering and studio to lead prototype hardware delivery Lead CAD studies for vehicle variants and platform development Contribute to technology roadmaps for future vehicles Qualifications: 5+ years of automotive industry experience, focused on early vehicle development Proven 3D CAD skills Hands-on practical experience in prototype and production assembly processes Experience in technology, system, and supplier selection Knowledge of steering, brakes, structures, and vehicle dynamics principles Project leadership and mentoring skills Travel domestically and internationally up to 20% as needed Advantageous: 10+ years of automotive industry experience Experience and proficiency with CATIA V5/V6 Knowledge of NVH principles Knowledge of vehicle crash safety principles Knowledge of body structures principles Experience developing vehicle level attributes Ability to run CAE analysis tools Education: BS/BEng or MS/MEng, or equivalent experience, in Mechanical Engineering or similar Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors. Prefix Corporation is an engineering services company, developing innovative design and engineering solutions for various industries. Continuously owned and operated by the same founding family for over 40 years, today the company operates multiple facilities in Michigan with over 300 employees, and has become a single-source American manufacturing, prototype, concept vehicle and production solutions provider to the automotive, aviation, motion picture, themed entertainment, and a variety of other industries. At Prefix, we are wanting motivated, ambitious people who put the needs of our customers first, bring creativity to their work and will do whatever it takes to achieve success. If you share our passion for providing innovative solutions to complex challenges, we want you on our team. We have an opportunity for a Senior Mechanical Engineer to join our team. This position will be involved in the creation of mechanical designs on multiple systems from concept to commissioning for the Themed Entertainment industry. This includes mechanism design, 3D Computer-Aided Design (CAD) models, drafting, and assembly of complex mechanical systems as well as involvement in structural analysis of said systems. This position will work in a team environment on defined tasks while also collaborating with other team members to meet the customer’s needs and requirements for Show and Ride systems. The position is located at our Rochester Hills, MI facility. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Convert customer ideas and requirements from concept design through possible production release using applicable engineering analysis to design components, subsystems and assemblies. Direct the design of mechanical, electromechanical and structural systems through the product design cycle while providing leadership, guidance, coaching, mentorship and technical support to team members. Participate and assist in the development and maintenance of Design Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (DFMEA), Design Validation Plan & Report (DVP&R) and associated engineering documents. Prepare, review and approval of customer deliverable design packages and reports and present mechanical design elements at formal reviews to team and customers. Review and approval of Bill of Materials (BOM’s) and all other required design documentation. Assure design are in compliance to customer and industry standards, and manage engineering change through completion including tracking and reporting of design hours budget to actual. Defines and develops hardware development tasks, manpower needs and required testing, in support of mock-ups, prototype / pre-production, and production builds. Coordinate with CAE/FEA resources for simulation analysis and part mitigation resolution and review and report status of analysis progression to defined schedule. Review and approve design of components, subsystems and assemblies to meet or exceed the required stress load conditions, duty cycle, acceleration, velocity and other related engineering performance requirements. Collaborate, manage and oversee allocated CAD resources for the refined development of 3D models and 2D drawings as required. Provide design recommendations, alternative solutions and risk assessment for resolution to mechanical, performance and operational design issues. Collaborate with other project stakeholders (quality, purchasing, manufacturing, etc.) on issues including but not limited to design for manufacturing feasibility, cost, ease of assembly and error-proofing. SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS (Required): Bachelor degree in mechanical engineering or related technical degree Minimum 6 years of engineering experience in automotive, machine design, aerospace or other related industry. Proficient using SolidWorks 2D/3D CAD (Computer-Aided Design) or similar operating system. Experience in the development and understanding of CAE (Computer-Aided Engineering) and/or Rigid Body Dynamics (RBD). Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel (intermediate), Outlook, and PowerPoint). SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS (Preferred): Master’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent. Knowledge on manufacturing processes in machining, composites and metal fabrication. Ability to multi-task and ability to support multiple programs at one time. Superior written and verbal communication skills and able to convey technical data to various audiences and thrive in a team environment, strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Work experience in themed entertainment industry. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: Direct Reports: 2-4 P.E. License preferred (not required) Travel Requirements: Up to 20% may be required. (Current valid passport preferred / not required) U.S. Citizen or legally authorized to work in the United States.

General Description:Select design concepts and fundamental technology to be used for new products or improvements for existing ones. Develop new products/processes. Provides engineering and technical support to production with respect to product specifications and requirements.Work effectively in a team environment with a cross-functional team: design, tooling, quality, manufacturing, finance, purchasing, sales.Coordinate product development and release with internal and external stakeholders throughout the development cycle. Position Specific Requirements:This position will be part of the innovation group and will report directly to the Senior Director of Innovation. In this role and as part of the global innovation team, you will provide your expertise using Computer-Aided Design (CAD) and Computer-Aided Engineering (CAE) programs to design and validate new product concepts. You will lead Design Reviews and DFMEA and PFMEA activities and guide and support the generation of the appropriate documentation required to successfully release new products. You will work in collaboration with a cross-functional team from manufacturing, engineering, and purchasing, to bring newly developed products from concept to production. You will be passionate about developing new and innovative solutions to complex automotive and mobility challenges leveraging Design for Sustainability principles. You will help to identify opportunities to improve the existing products based on the voice of customers, competitive product benchmarking, and close collaborations with IAC suppliers. You will lead innovation projects through IAC's innovation pipeline by coordinating resources, managing budgets, and measuring and tracking project progress. Education:Bachelor's degree in materials/polymer engineering.Experience:8+ years of experience in plastic part design and validation, in the automotive industry. Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:Prior Experience with New Product Development in the Automotive industry is highly desired. Extensive experience with CAD and CAE software for product design and validation. Knowledge and experience with different manufacturing processes used in automotive interiors such as Injection molding, compression molding and thermoforming. Solid understanding of different plastics and composite materials, used in automotive interior and exterior. A fundamental understanding of the Mechanical as well as Functional requirements for automotive interior components. Knowledge and experience in DFMEA, PFMEA, and DOE methodology. Working knowledge of AS400, Prolink, Microsoft Project, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word. Strong interpersonal skills to work closely and help to manage both internal and external stakeholders.

Role and Responsibilities Who We Are: CAE Vision: Our vision is to be the worldwide partner of choice in defense and security, civil aviation, and healthcare by revolutionizing our customers’ training and critical operations with digitally immersive solutions to elevate safety, efficiency and readiness. CAE Defense & Security Mission: CAE's Defense and Security business unit focuses on helping prepare military customers to develop and maintain the highest levels of mission readiness. CAE Values: Empowerment, Innovation, Excellence, Integrity and OneCAE make us who we are and we strive to make a difference in the world while helping each other succeed. What We Have to Offer: Comprehensive and competitive benefits package and flexibility that promotes work-life balance A work environment where all employees are valued, respected and safe Freedom to succeed by enabling team members to deliver, take initiatives and make decisions Recognition, professional development, advancement and having fun! Summary The LSE role is to provide the overall COE Technical direction and keep the COE’s baseline design up to date and accurate. Additionally, the LSE will work with and on the CAE Technology Roadmap as well as CAE Reference Architecture(s) to ensure solid standard designs within their COE projects and amongst the other COEs and their projects. Each LSE will also serve as an independent technical reviewer to the other COEs for proposal, technical reviews and technical performance evaluations of the other COE projects and resources. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Leads the Systems Engineering aspects of all lifecycle phases and the work performed by the various engineering components ensuring that various teams preform to needs and follow process:    Requirements Engineering System(s) Engineering including:      Project Engineers Program/Project Management System Engineers, Architects Technical Authorities Electrical Engineering Mechanical Engineering Software Engineering Logistical Engineering Configuration Engineering Conduct system engineering development tasks that includes system requirements analysis, system design, system integration support, test procedure development, and requirement verification and validation. Performing system requirements analysis using Model Based System Engineering (SysML) and other system engineering tools. Reviews project specifications, generates System /Sub-system requirements, and assists in creating component specifications. Conduct or coordinate system level analysis and trade studies and complex design risk trade-off analysis. Perform project requirements verification, cross-references to test documentation, and assists with the development of test plans and test procedures. Leads and advises on the business development Lead to Award (L2A) process technical direction and follows standards and processes concerning the L2A activities. Advise on the design activities and be the overall design authority during the Capture and Proposal phase of a program. Advise on the design activities and be the overall design reviewer/approver during the development phase of all projects within their assigned COE. Identify risk and cost driving design issues to support the Solution Development, Project Planning, Monitoring & Control and Risk Management processes. Follows and improves corporate process. Research new technologies for simulation methods and system architectures. Qualifications and Education Requirements Qualification Requirements: Ability to lead and perform all Systems Life Cycle (SLC) tasks Demonstrated requirement writing abilities Use of IBM DOORS at a knowledgeable user level Knowledge of system and systems of systems design Knowledge of the design progression of an architecture from proposal conceptual design through the final implemented design package release and approval by the customer/end-user stakeholders Ability to write reports, business correspondence, technical specifications, proposals, and procedure manuals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required. Must be eligible for DoD Personal Security Clearance Due to U.S. Government contract requirements, only U.S. citizens are eligible for this role. Education & Experience Requirements: BS, MS in Systems Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Aerospace Engineering. Advanced degree preferred. Must possess at least 10 years’ experience as a Project Engineer, Systems Engineer, Systems Architect, Systems Development, Design, and Delivery. Preferred Skills Model Based Systems Engineering concepts, experience and knowledge Knowledge of modeling tool use and experience desired CAMEO, Enterprise Architect, or Rhapsody Understand context diagramming and its application to architecture Technical Leadership skills or training Certification or willingness to obtain any of the INCOSE ASEP, CSEP, or ESEP. Certification or willingness to obtain from OMG any of the SysML Model User, SysML Model Builder Fundamental, Intermediate, or Advanced. Knowledge of SysML and UML practical use Ability to read, analyze, and interpret professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations Security Responsibilities Must comply with all company security and data protection / usage policies and procedures. Personally responsible for proper marking and handling of all information and materials, in any form. Shall not divulge any information, or afford access, to other employees not having a need-to-know. Shall not divulge information outside company without management approval. All government and proprietary information will be accessed and stored electronically on company provided resources. Incumbent must be eligible for DoD Personal Security Clearance. Due to U.S. Government contract requirements, only U.S. citizens are eligible for this role. Work Environment Must be able to travel CONUS and to International sites Should be familiar with and able to support Engineering or Operations staff on any type and sub-component of training devices. Must be willing to work overtime Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Must be able to sit down for long lengths of time. Must be able to climb stairs. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Test Engineer III - Contractor: Sr. Mechanical Test Engineer, Energy & Charging Systems
column7: What to Expect       As a Reliability Test Engineer focusing on Thermal Systems, you will play a key role in designing reliability into Tesla’s energy and charging systems. This role follows the reliability lifecycle of the product from concept to design, development testing/analysis, manufacturing, and field operation to design-in, confirm, and grow exceptional reliability at every stage. You will investigate failures through physics of failure analysis and physical testing to accurately predict the thermal system’s robustness and optimize product reliability while accelerating Tesla’s next gen products’ time to market.     What You’ll Do  Set and communicate reliability requirements and targets for site, product, subsystem, and components Create Fault Trees and reliability block diagrams to assess system reliability and warranty analysis Facilitate Design FMEA sessions to drive reliable design choices and improve validation test programs Analyze usage and environmental conditions from the field to improve requirement setting and testing methods Apply statistical analysis to test (accelerated life) and field (life) data to inform reliability physics modeling/analyses and associated corrective actions Work closely with Design and Reliability Data engineers to create/interpret/validate numeric models of fielded and in-test products Specify reliability validation plans for components and subsystems using physics of failure Provide guidance on sample size requirements and durations for reliability testing using lifetime models and reliability statistics Drive reliability assessments in product design reviews and clearly communicate risk at each phase of product development and for released products Facilitate failure analysis to understand root cause and drive resolution of failures occurring during product development Research failure mechanisms to build more robust validation plans and influence design choices Influence supplier selection for higher reliability and provide clear guidance on reliability requirements and demonstration to suppliers Provide reliability design guidelines and apply reliability lessons learned to enable continuous improvement Answer complex questions on fleet usage and behavior to enable proactive health monitoring, grow reliability, and minimize field failures What You’ll Bring  Understanding of accelerated testing methods, governing equations, and physics of failure for different failure mechanisms Understanding of applied statistics and reliability statistics (Weibull distribution, Maximum Likelihood Estimation, Bayesian methods, Monte Carlo analysis, etc.) Working knowledge of failure analysis techniques such as optical microscopy, SEM, CSAM, X-ray, cross-sectioning and EDX. Knowledge of the ReliaSoft Synthesis Platform, including Weibull++, BlockSim, ALTA, RGA, and xFMEA Knowledge of methods to design-in reliability for electronics, including electronic computer-aided design and mechanical computer-aided engineering (CAE) data into 3D finite element models (e.g. using Sherlock) Working knowledge of programming languages, preferably Python Strong communication skills and experience leading cross functional teams Knowledge of reliability growth techniques, such as Crow-AMSAA and Crow Extended is a plus Knowledge of reliability warranty analysis and reliability prediction methods. Experience working with complex thermal systems. Minimum of a Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering or related field and one or more years of industry experience in a reliability engineering role, Master’s degree in Reliability Engineering preferred.

Test Engineer III - Contractor: Sr. CAE Engineer, Semi, Drive Systems
column7: What to Expect       The Drive Systems team designs, optimizes, and engineers world class EV powertrains that push the boundaries of efficiency, performance, and time to market. This can only be done with a deep understanding of engineering first principles and the ability to leverage finite element analysis early and often during the design process.          We are looking for a Mechanical Design Engineer, CAE for our Drive Systems team. This is a hybrid role between a Mechanical Design Engineer and a CAE Analyst. You will analyze and optimize revolutionary vehicle designs never before executed, enabled by clean-sheet design methodology and Tesla’s innovative EV architecture. Tesla doesn’t work with the typical barriers between the design and engineering teams; at Tesla you are empowered to push boundaries by working closely with all groups involved and help drive for the best overall outcome.     What You’ll Do  Developing highly predictive finite element models in collaboration with a small team of design engineers Performing modal, linear/non-linear, durability/fatigue, random vibration and shock analysis to evaluate structures and recommend design solutions that balance the needs of engineering, suppliers, and program management Using first principle thinking and structural optimization to meet/exceed performance metrics, while minimizing weight and cost Working with reliability and test to develop load cases and cycle counts to be used for CAE and component level test in order to satisfy program and industry requirements Working with both internal and external testing groups for model verification and validation What You’ll Bring  5 + years of relevant experience Strong working knowledge of finite element analysis techniques, solid mechanics, structural dynamics and numerical methods Expert level component/system design analysis including modal, linear/non-linear static, durability/fatigue, random vibration and shock analysis Experience with Nastran, Optistruct, LS-Dyna or similar FEM codes Experience with Matlab or Python Familiarity within 3D CAD software, preferably CATIA V5/6 Able to work under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines A passion for a sustainable energy future and high performance, high efficiency vehicles

Group Description At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle. We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we’re more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it’s our talented people who lead us on this journey. Role Summary Magna is seeking a highly motivated Senior Mechanical Engineer to join the New Mobility group in Lowell, MA. This engineer will take a lead role in mechanical development of autonomous robots and new mobility projects to move goods and people - generating and evaluating innovative concepts, building and testing designs, and launching them into production. Key Responsibilities Design:       Requirements analysis, Mechanical architecture development, component design and assembly management In depth analysis, simulation, development of design documentation (3D models, 2D drawings, ME/EE interface, DFMEA) Mechanical integration of PCBAs and sensors (e.g. radar, lidar, cameras, etc.) Thermal management, design and analysis of electronic assemblies Prototyping and Testing:       Verify mechanical requirements at component and assembly level testing. Support design, fabrication and build of test set-ups and test equipment used by design and test engineering groups. Support building, modifying and verifying of engineering prototype samples, Support ED, DV, PV testing by conducting tests and documenting results as needed. Key Qualifications/Requirements 6+ years’ relevant experience regarding the Responsibility/ Activities in serial development. Experience with related robotic and vehicle systems. Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects; requires good time management and organizational skills to meet stringent deadlines. Knowledge in mechanical design, development, and testing of robotic or mechatronic systems. Knowledge of structural and thermal design methodologies. Knowledge in mechanical analysis techniques (first order through CAE). Additional Information Awareness. Unity. Empowerment. At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility   At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.    We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.    Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.  We are currently seeking experts in the field of Crashworthiness & Occupant Protection CAE. This position requires an experienced professional with a balanced approach to CAE and testing. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches their work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment. Role Execute simulations to evaluate full vehicle structural crashworthiness performance for high and low speed frontal, side, rear impact and pedestrian protection Generate feasible vehicle design recommendations, working cross functionally with engineering teams. Assist with building a high-fidelity CAE model from CAD data. Create analysis reports and communicate program status to relevant teams. Participate in post-test teardowns to correlate CAE results to physical tests. Where appropriate, conduct DOE/DFSS studies by utilizing optimization tools, on vehicle designs to meet performance requirements within the constraints of conflicting attributes such cost and mass. Support the creation of standard work procedures for delivering quality models and simulation results. Lead/mentor junior engineers Qualifications This position requires an experienced professional with a balanced approach to CAE and testing Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches their work with vigor and determination 5+ years’ experience in full vehicle crashworthiness CAE working for an Automotive OEM or equivalent experience Knowledge of Global regulatory and consumer safety requirements: FMVSS / UNECE / China, USNCAP, IIHS, Euro NCAP, China NCAP etc Strong analytical skills to draw meaningful conclusions from CAE results Demonstrable experience of root causing test performance, and correlation of CAE models Demonstrable ability to concisely present technical issues, CAE results, findings and propose next steps Advanced user of tools such as: Ansa, LS-Dyna, Meta-post, Primer, Hyperworks etc Experience with CATIA Education BS minimum in Mechanical Engineering or similar Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors.  California (Bay Area) - $115,000 - $165,000 Additional Compensation and Benefits: Lucid offers a wide range of competitive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, vacation, and 401k. The successful candidate may also be eligible to participate in Lucid’s equity program and/or a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing such programs. (Cash or equity incentive awards, if any, will depend on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and company performance.)  Lucid maintains your privacy according to its Candidate Privacy Notice. If you are a California resident, please refer to our California Candidate Privacy Notice. Company Information PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of high-quality light-, medium-, and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF nameplates. PACCAR also designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines, provides financial services and information technology, and distributes truck parts related to its principal business. Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services — you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started! Division Information Kenworth Truck Company, founded in 1923, is the manufacturer of The World’s Best® heavy and medium duty trucks. With an excellent heritage of quality, innovation, and technology, Kenworth has played an essential role in the development of trucks that are more fuel efficient, productive, and economical to operate. Today, Kenworth is leading transportation innovation with the introduction of battery-electric vehicles, exploration of fuel cell electric powertrains, and autonomous driving systems. Kenworth is committed to fostering an environment of diversity, equality, and inclusivity in the workplace. Requisition Summary: Kenworth Truck Company is seeking a Lead CAE Durability Engineer to support Product Development and Validation by using CAE to analyze new designs and provide design recommendations to meet functional/performance requirements. This role offers professional development and access to global opportunities in a challenging, high-performance environment with the opportunity to grow your expertise and be recognized among your peers. Job Functions / Responsibilities: Analyze components, sub-assemblies, assemblies, and full vehicle using FEA tools (such as ABAQUS, LS-DYNA, Altair products), Fatigue life calculation tools (such as nCode, Fe-safe) Develop DFMEA driven upfront CAE scope, performance requirement targets, and plan for Design Development and Validation for Durability, Stiffness, NVH and Strength Guide Engineering Design in the development, tuning and optimization to create durable components and assemblies Lead component, sub-systems, and vehicle testing to correlate CAE models Collaborate with suppliers/vendors to improve the material database and accuracy of CAE models Develop and refine CAE analysis procedures and process through method development and capability enhancements Collaborate with Property Owner for Durability/NVH for new vehicles Conduct or coordinate work with internal & external CAE and test resources including other PACCAR divisions Collaborate with Property Owner to conduct or coordinate benchmark tests of PACCAR and competitive vehicles Deliver CAE reports stating clear recommendations and proposals for improvements to Engineering teams Manage delivery of outsourced CAE activities Develop technology roadmaps for Kenworth simulation and analysis toolset Mentor vehicle engineers in the principles of design for Structural Durability, Fatigue, and NVH Qualifications: Technical Skills (required): 7+ years of experience with Implicit (static and dynamic structural analysis) and explicit analysis Expert in linear & non-linear FEA software: Optistruct, Nastran, ABAQUS, and LS-DYNA Working experience of fatigue life calculators (nCode, Fe-safe) Knowledge and previous working experience with structural analysis Knowledge of Fatigue theory Experience with CAD software such as Creo Parametric Demonstrate the ability and desire to learn new tools and stay updated with the latest technological advancements in the industry Work independently while building cooperation among individuals and departments, sharing information and resources, and working to achieve goals and outcomes meeting expectations of internal and external customers Effective analysis and project management skills and excellent engineering judgment Effective communication, administration, and presentation skills Self-driven with concentration on ownership, execution and accountability Ability to manage personal workload, demonstrate flexibility, initiative, and the willingness to respond to shifting timelines and project demands Technical Skills (preferred): Interest or experience with multi-body dynamics and vehicle dynamics Interest or experience with explicit analysis such as crash or drop Scripting experience – Python and MatLab preferred Background in the automotive or heavy truck industry Education: Bachelor’s degree in Structural/Mechanical Engineering or equivalent required; Master’s degree in Structural/Mechanical Engineering or equivalent preferred As a U.S. PACCAR employee, you have a full range of benefit options including: 401k with up to a 5% company match Fully funded pension plan that provides monthly benefits after retirement Comprehensive paid time off – minimum of 10 paid vacation days (additional days are provided with additional seniority/years of service), 12 paid holidays, and sick time Tuition reimbursement for continued education Medical, dental, and vision plans for you and your family Flexible spending accounts (FSA) and health savings account (HSA) Paid short-and long-term disability programs Life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance EAP services include wellness plans, estate planning, financial counseling, and more Additional Job Board Information At PACCAR, we value talent and promote growth and development. We carefully consider numerous compensation factors including your education, training, or experience. The salary range for Lead Structural CAE Engineer is $93,000-$145,500 annually. This position is also eligible for a holiday gift. Additionally, this role is eligible for the full range of benefit options listed above. Why engineering at Stryker? At Stryker we are dedicated to improving lives, with a passion for researching and developing new medical device products. As an engineer at Stryker, you will be proud of the work that you will be doing, using cutting-edge technologies to make healthcare better. Here, you will work in a supportive culture with other incredibly talented and intelligent people, creating industry-leading medical technology products. You will also have growth opportunities as we have a culture that supports your personal and professional development. Need another reason to apply? Check out these 8 reasons to join Stryker's engineering team: https://www.strykercareersblog.com/post/8-reasons-to-join-strykers-engineering-team We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com Job Description: We are seeking to hire a Senior Mechanical Engineer, R&D - NP, to support Orthopaedic Instruments. This is a great opportunity to make an impact on the future development of research and product development for Orthopaedic Instruments Power Tools. WHO WE WANT: Dedicated Achievers. Who are relentless about quality and deliver safe and robust solutions. Motivated problem solvers and product launchers. Who thrive in a fast-paced environment and will stop at nothing to ensure a project is complete and meets regulations and expectations. Relationship builders. We value relationships, and we win together. User-focused creators. Keeping the customer and requirements squarely in focus and who imagine with the user in mind, developing technology that helps change patients’ lives. Curious Learners. Who seek out cutting edge research and information to enhance their ability to develop new ideas into reality WHAT YOU WILL DO: As the Senior Mechanical Engineer in the R&D department, you will be responsible for understanding customer pain points and provide your design solutions from concept to production, in addition to providing technical focus across our Mechanical Engineering program team. This role will collaborate with other focused thought leaders and partner with R&D teams throughout Stryker to conceptualize, develop and release solutions to improve surgery outcomes. This is an exciting space for a skilled engineer that is eager to collaborate and be a part of something new at Stryker. General Responsibilities: Under minimal supervision, research, design, develop, modify, and verify components/modules for medical devices. Translate design inputs to engineering specifications and produce sub-system level designs. Develop and analyze solutions, prototyping one or more options to provide proof of concept. Apply fundamental and some advanced concepts, practices and procedures for problem solving. Under minimal supervision, work with R&D, Quality, Manufacturing, Regulatory, Clinical, Marketing and Project Management to ensure project success. Quickly process and assimilate procedures, policies, processes, systems, and technology required. Work on complex problems, applying advanced experience and learnings. Works as key member of the team, collaborating with others and solidifying relationships. Business Responsibilities: Demonstrate advanced understanding of customer needs and design inputs. Demonstrate proficiency with product’s intended use and clinical procedures. Learn how the financial models are constructed. Med Device Compliance: Follow fundamental industry standards, design requirements and test strategies which apply to regulatory requirements. Independently create or refine engineering documentation, such as the Design History file. Follow R&D procedure like design controls and risk management, per the Quality Management System. WHAT YOU NEED: Required: Bachelor of Science in Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or BioMedical. 2+ years of work experience. Preferred: Working knowledge and understanding of mechanical engineering practices and design principles. Technical ability to create engineering drawings and models, applying GD&T and CAE tools. Demonstrated ability to apply knowledge of materials and manufacturing processes to product design. Ability to Communicate basic plans and technical information to team members. Demonstrated experience with Creo CAD and/or Solidworks About Stryker Our benefits: 12 paid holidays annually Health benefits include: Medical and prescription drug insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, critical illness insurance, accident insurance, hospital indemnity insurance, personalized healthcare support, wellbeing program and tobacco cessation program. Financial benefits include Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs), 401(k) plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), basic life and AD&D insurance, and short-term disability insurance. For a more detailed overview of our benefits or time off, please follow this link to learn more: US Stryker employee benefits  About Stryker Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with its customers, is driven to make healthcare better. The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 130 million patients annually. More information is available at stryker.com.  Know someone at Stryker? Be sure to have them submit you as a referral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program on our referral page  Stryker is driven to work together with our customers to make healthcare better. Employees and new hires in sales and field roles that require access to customer accounts as a function of the job may be required, depending on customer requirements, to obtain various vaccinations as an essential function of their role.

Test Engineer III - Contractor: Sr. Staff Thermal Engineer - Heat Exchanger
column7: About Rivian:     Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.  As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.  Role Summary:     The role of Technical Specialist – Heat Exchangers is to interface internally with Body, Studio, Packaging, Attribute, NVH, Aerodynamics, CAE, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, etc to provide guidance on design and manufacturing of heat exchangers and heat exchanger modules, and externally with suppliers to cascade Rivian’s requirements and oversee design, validation, and release process for Rivian’s current and future thermal system.  Responsibilities:  Be the subject matter expert in design, manufacture, and mass production of heat exchangers and heat exchanger modules for vehicular thermal system, including but not limited to condenser, outside heat exchanger for heat pump, high-temperature and low-temperature radiator, battery chiller, liquid-cooled condenser, cabin evaporator, cabin condenser, or heater core in HVAC, and front-end heat exchanger fan module In particular, be the owner of front-end heat exchanger fan module including radiator, OHX/condenser, fan, shroud, and active-grille shutter (AGS): a) Interface with Body, Studio, Packaging, Attribute, NVH, Aerodynamics, and CAE engineering to ensure optimal design and integration for aerodynamic and range efficiency; b) Support supply chain with engineering requirements throughout quotation and sourcing; c) Interface with suppliers on design, release, tooling, and validation; d) Support critical program milestones and build events, e.g. Virtual Release, Virtual Build, Design Verification Build, Manufacturing Verification Build, etc Guide Design & Release team in development of Engineering Specification, Design Verification, & Production Verification plans for heat exchangers and heat exchanger modules Develop/Review other foundation documents as required, including risk assessment/management, DFMEA, PFMEA, and Functional Safety Interface with plant Series Engineer, Manufacturing Engineering, Process Engineering, General Assembly and ensure all Design for Manufacturing and Design for Assembly standards are met Support/Coordinate system development between Design & Release team and Testing/CAE team, Attribute, and Controls; provide input to bench/vehicle test plan; decompose system requirements to heat exchanger sizing and heat exchanger module design Qualifications:  Minimum BSME degree with in mechanical/automotive engineering 10+ years of experience related to heat exchanger design, release, and production Tier 1 supplier experience on heat exchangers and heat exchange module a plus Proficiency in CAD for design and release; CATIA V6 preferred Field experience of manufacturing and logistics for heat exchangers and heat exchanger modules Knowledge on thermal, mechanical, NVH, durability, corrosion, and electrical requirements for heat exchangers and heat exchanger modules Experience on heat pump technology and development a plus Experience on at least one full product cycle from concept creation to mass production Ability to work and communicate effectively with peers and leadership Ability to work independently and proactively in fast-paced environment Company Statements:  Equal Opportunity   Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com. As a Manufacturing Engineer at Cover, you'll play a pivotal role in redefining how homes are designed, built, and lived in by owning parts of the production process, developing unique assembly equipment and working with Product Engineers to develop easy to assemble components. You'll be responsible for ensuring manufacturing improvement projects are executed on time, parts and assemblies produced meet quality targets, and production processes continuously improve. At the same time, you'll join a highly motivated and innovated group of people who are working to modernize a centuries old industry. - You’ll work closely with a multidisciplinary team of engineers, architects and designers to manufacture the components and assemblies necessary to achieve our precision assembly system. - You must be flexible and communicative while reviewing and modifying engineering drawings, creating manufacturing processes as well as tracking and improving product quality. - You will design and implement production equipment, processes, and tooling. - You will develop and implement reporting methods for live production progress tracking. - You will work autonomously to solve production issues quickly and implement permanent corrective actions in a scrappy, but effective manner. - Have a key role in developing a manufacturing process to help solve the - global housing crisis - Being part of a team that values autonomy and moving quickly - Involvement in every aspect of the manufacturing process from design to assembly - Technical degree from an accredited program, along with additional training is preferred but not required. - Minimum 7 years experience fabricating, building, machining for prototyping purposes; experience with production and/or molding composites a plus. - History of continual improvement and achievement: identifying and implementing changes that improve operation and execution of your role and product. - Demonstrated history of producing extraordinary results in short timeframes with a high degree of autonomy. - Exceptional fabrication and building knowledge across metals, plastic and wood composites, coatings and their assembly. - Skill in welding, machining. - Capability to use and interrogate Computer Aided Drawing (CAD) and Engineering (CAE) documents. - Strong understanding of executing given GD&T requirements. - Strong verbal, written, and visual communication, both on paper, white board and digital medium. - Experience with CNC laser or water cutting systems. COMPENSATION All our positions offer a compensation package that includes equity and robust benefits. The overall cash salary for this position ranges from *$34-$40* per hour. Our compensation package extends beyond cash salary and encompasses various elements that contribute to a comprehensive rewards system. In addition to a competitive pay rate, we offer equity through stock options, health and fitness reimbursements, high-quality company-subsidized healthcare, generous paid time off (PTO), and complimentary weekly catered meals available on-site. Cover’s aims to be competitive with it’s overall compensation packages relative to the market considering the company stage, industry, funding, and location. This market range includes pay rate, applicable bonuses, and equity – which are each important components of an offer from Cover. More details can be provided during the interview. Cover’s pay ranges are informed and defined through professional-grade salary surveys and compensation data sources. The actual compensation package offered to a successful candidate will additionally be influenced by a variety of factors including the essential functions of the role, experience, credentials & certifications, educational attainment, skill level, and prior accomplishments. Our mission is to make thoughtfully designed and well-built homes for everyone. We believe that having a diverse and inclusive workplace brings a range of unique perspectives to the table and helps us better accomplish this mission. We are an equal opportunity employer to all, regardless of age, ancestry, color, disability (mental and physical), exercising the right to family care and medical leave, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religious creed, sex (includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, and related medical conditions), and sexual orientation. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination.
