Summary The LSE role is to provide the overall COE Technical direction and keep the COE’s baseline design up to date and accurate. Additionally, the LSE will work with and on the CAE Technology Roadmap as well as CAE Reference Architecture(s) to ensure solid standard designs within their COE projects and amongst the other COEs and their projects. Each LSE will also serve as an independent technical reviewer to the other COEs for proposal, technical reviews and technical performance evaluations of the other COE projects and resources. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Leads the Systems Engineering aspects of all lifecycle phases and the work performed by the various engineering components ensuring that various teams preform to needs and follow process:    Requirements Engineering System(s) Engineering including:      Project Engineers Program/Project Management System Engineers, Architects Technical Authorities Electrical Engineering Mechanical Engineering Software Engineering Logistical Engineering Configuration Engineering Conduct system engineering development tasks that includes system requirements analysis, system design, system integration support, test procedure development, and requirement verification and validation. Performing system requirements analysis using Model Based System Engineering (SysML) and other system engineering tools. Reviews project specifications, generates System /Sub-system requirements, and assists in creating component specifications. Conduct or coordinate system level analysis and trade studies and complex design risk trade-off analysis. Perform project requirements verification, cross-references to test documentation, and assists with the development of test plans and test procedures. Leads and advises on the business development Lead to Award (L2A) process technical direction and follows standards and processes concerning the L2A activities. Advise on the design activities and be the overall design authority during the Capture and Proposal phase of a program. Advise on the design activities and be the overall design reviewer/approver during the development phase of all projects within their assigned COE. Identify risk and cost driving design issues to support the Solution Development, Project Planning, Monitoring & Control and Risk Management processes. Follows and improves corporate process. Research new technologies for simulation methods and system architectures. Qualifications and Education Requirements Qualification Requirements: Ability to lead and perform all Systems Life Cycle (SLC) tasks Demonstrated requirement writing abilities Use of IBM DOORS at a knowledgeable user level Knowledge of system and systems of systems design Knowledge of the design progression of an architecture from proposal conceptual design through the final implemented design package release and approval by the customer/end-user stakeholders Ability to write reports, business correspondence, technical specifications, proposals, and procedure manuals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required. Must be eligible for DoD Personal Security Clearance Due to U.S. Government contract requirements, only U.S. citizens are eligible for this role. Education & Experience Requirements: BS, MS in Systems Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Aerospace Engineering. Advanced degree preferred. Must possess at least 10 years’ experience as a Project Engineer, Systems Engineer, Systems Architect, Systems Development, Design, and Delivery. Preferred Skills Model Based Systems Engineering concepts, experience and knowledge Knowledge of modeling tool use and experience desired CAMEO, Enterprise Architect, or Rhapsody Understand context diagramming and its application to architecture Technical Leadership skills or training Certification or willingness to obtain any of the INCOSE ASEP, CSEP, or ESEP. Certification or willingness to obtain from OMG any of the SysML Model User, SysML Model Builder Fundamental, Intermediate, or Advanced. Knowledge of SysML and UML practical use Ability to read, analyze, and interpret professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations Security Responsibilities Must comply with all company security and data protection / usage policies and procedures. Personally responsible for proper marking and handling of all information and materials, in any form. Shall not divulge any information, or afford access, to other employees not having a need-to-know. Shall not divulge information outside company without management approval. All government and proprietary information will be accessed and stored electronically on company provided resources. Incumbent must be eligible for DoD Personal Security Clearance. Due to U.S. Government contract requirements, only U.S. citizens are eligible for this role. Work Environment Must be able to travel CONUS and to International sites Should be familiar with and able to support Engineering or Operations staff on any type and sub-component of training devices. Must be willing to work overtime Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Must be able to sit down for long lengths of time. Must be able to climb stairs. About Fisker Inc.    California-based Fisker Inc. is revolutionizing the automotive industry by developing the most emotionally desirable and eco-friendly electric vehicles on Earth. Passionately driven by a vision of a clean future for all, the company is on a mission to become the No. 1 e-mobility service provider with the world’s most sustainable vehicles. To learn more, visit      www.FiskerInc.com   – and enjoy exclusive content across Fisker’s social media channels:      Facebook  ,      Instagram  ,      Twitter  ,      YouTube   and      LinkedIn  . Download the revolutionary new Fisker mobile app from the      App Store   or      Google Play   store.    Role Overview    Fisker Inc. is a design led pioneering mobility technology company researching, developing and producing next generation electrically powered vehicles. As the electrification revolution begins to infiltrate the automotive industry, Fisker are focused on delivering advanced smart solutions across the electrification ecosystem from charging, to battery technology, powertrain and connected vehicle functionality. Strong product design is at our core where distinctive emotional yet cost effective style meet the latest in cutting edge technology.    Lead Engineer, Multi-Body Dynamic Simulation (MBD)    As a lead multi-body dynamic simulation engineer, you will be responsible for MBS model buildup, validation, and correlation and continuously update the model during the development of the vehicle.    Requirements:      Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering. Master’s and Ph.D. preferred.        8+ years MBS simulation experience in the automotive industry. (10+ years experience for Bachelor degree).        In depth knowledge of vehicle suspension, motion kinematics, and overall function of the system.        Adams skill is a must.        Excellent understanding of vehicle dynamics principles.        Solid background of mechanics, kinematics, and vibration.      Preferred Skills:      Knowledge of rigid body mode decoupling for the engine or EDU.        Good understanding the balance of vehicle dynamic, ride comfort, and vibration.        Good understanding of vehicle NVH and isolation.      Responsibilities:      Develop and evaluate tire, suspension, steering and brakes subsystem models in Adams.        Perform ride comfort simulation and provide design change direction.        Perform K&C evaluation and familiar with K&C tuning.        Understand RLDA and VRLDA and able to help durability group to abstract the load.        Develop test plans and provide support for driver-in-the-loop simulator tests.        Use simulation to tune the system to satisfy the requirements of vehicle dynamic (steering, handling, acceleration and braking), NVH, and ride comfort.        Collaborate with other teams, cross-function check for design changes and provide load information for chassis and durability.        Develop CAE modelling methods, requirements & perform correlation studies with physical test data.        Work collaboratively with attribute, testing and product teams to enhance the ride comfort predictability.      Expected Salary Range: $67,480.00 - $167,980.00 a year.    Additional compensation: Salary is one part of total compensation which includes bonuses, equity awards as applicable, and benefits. An employee is eligible to participate in Fisker’s equity program, subject to the rules governing such programs.    Benefits: Fisker provides comprehensive medical, prescription, dental, vision, and disability insurance packages for full-time employees, their spouse or domestic partner, and children up to age 26. Coverage is effective on the first day of employment, and Fisker covers most of the premiums for employees.    The salary offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors including market location, job-related knowledge, education/training, certifications, key skills, experience, internal peer equity as well as business considerations. Fisker reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position within the salary range listed, considering the wide variety of factors listed above.    Fisker Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment at Fisker Inc. is governed based on merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status    #LI-Hybrid    #LI-JN1

Must demonstrate experience in identifying field conditions that can impact the project objectives and scope and articulate them in a clear manner to project tea Reviewing project scope and obtaining deliverables and due dates Code reviews, client standards, and industry guidelines Perform engineering calculations Prepare contract documents (redline / produce floor plans, details, flow diagrams, and schedules Prepare specifications Construction administration (Answering RFIs, review of shop drawings) Demonstrated ability to work with vendors and contractors, while interfacing with multiple departments, and working with internal customers to manage projects, policies, and procedures. Attending project meetings  Qualifications: Successful candidates will have in-depth knowledge of general building construction for process systems, as well as complete knowledge regarding the interpretation of code compliance requirements and industry standards for plumbing and process utilities Experience in designing and engineering of plumbing and/or process utility piping systems in the Pharmaceutical, Biotech, and Healthcare industries with additional knowledge of purified water, compressed air, compressed gases, vacuum, plant and clean utility, ethanol, HVAC, cryogenic liquids, neutralization systems and process utilities. Working knowledge of cGMP codes and standards required Working Knowledge of CIP/SIP, clean room design/requirements, pharmaceutical process sanitary connections, valves and supply loops Prepares complex process engineering computations, material quantity takeoffs, estimates, surveys, and P&ID's (Process & Instrument Design). Completes a variety of process engineering assignments such as drawings, specifications, and other materials suitable for procurement and construction purposes. Prepares detailed requisitions for equipment and materials. Reviews supplier drawing submittals and performs technical bid analyses. Prepares and issues specifications, data sheets, and other construction documents. Provides technical guidance to CAD Designer/Drafters and lower level Process Engineers working on the same project. May be required to provide the seal and signature of the professional engineer, as appropriate, ensuring compliance with all applicable codes, regulations, and ordinances. May act in an advisory capacity to senior management personnel on process engineering related matters. Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate. Education Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Chemical Engineering (or related field) and 8+ years of related work experience Professional Engineer registration may be required Proficiency in utilizing CAD and other PC software packages typically associated with engineering is required Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Not Applicable/None  This position is part of our Critical Infrastructure team. Transforming the Future with the Convergence of Simulation and Data Senior Solutions Engineer – Structures Do you like a challenge, are you a complex thinker who likes to solve problems? If so, then you might be the new Altairian we are searching for. At Altair, your curiosity matters. We pride ourselves on a business culture that enables open, creative thinking, and we deeply value our employees and their contributions towards our clients' success, as well as our own. Job Summary: This position in Altair’s Global Technical Team will support technical pre and post sales activities for our worldwide customer base. You will be contributing to the success of a team of engineering specialists and account managers in the different countries by increasing the deployment of Altair's solutions dedicated to linear structure/fatigue/vibrations and other analysis solutions, along with optimization of other highly nonlinear structural applications. The work will involve daily communication over email and web presentation with clients and prospects to help understand their simulation and design goals related to those types of applications and how the suite of Altair simulation tools can be used to achieve these goals. This position will allow you to greatly expand your technical knowledge and abilities into all aspects of structural analysis and optimization, and expose you to its applications to various industry verticals. You will also gain understanding of various tools in Altair’s software suite and also exposure to complementing technology like High Performance Computing and Data Analysis  What You Will Do:Enabling customers to use and deploy Altair's products of in pre- and post-sales situations.Provide technical support for both pre & post sales such as training and technical end user support, sales presentations, product demonstrations, as well as seminars.Assist customers and prospects with software evaluation through proof of concepts and benchmarks when required.Develop materials for our knowledge database, technical demonstrations, seminars, etc.Interact and learn with development teams & Collect feedback to guarantee our customer’s requirements are met in developing new and/or upgraded productsWhat You Will Need: Basics: Masters in Mechanical engineering with specialization Structures or FEAExperience/Skills : 3+ years in the industry using FEA in structural domain. Aptitude for solving engineering problemsAbility to work well both autonomously and within a team environmentFormal presentation or training delivery skills Strong oral and written communication skills, in English.    Preferred:Familiarity with Altair solutions like OptiStruct and HyperWorks solutions is preferredFamiliarity with at least one non-Altair CAE solutions/environments.Experience in customer success, technical support, presales, technical sales will be valued.Experience with Fatigue, ideally with other commercial tools.Some other expertise in the structural domain like Structural Optimization, nonlinar or NVH. Strong organization and time management skillsStrong oral and written communication skills, in at least other language other than English. How You Will Be Successful: Envision the Future Communicate Honestly and Broadly Seek Technology and Business “Firsts” Embrace Diversity and Take Risks What We Offer: Competitive SalaryComprehensive Benefit PackageOutstanding Work/Life BalanceFlex TimeEmployee Stock Purchase Program401(k) with matching contributionsPaid holidaysPaid Time Off for Community ServiceCollaborative environmentCharitable Matching Program Why Work with Us: Altair is a global technology company providing software and cloud solutions in the areas of product development, high-performance computing (HPC) and artificial intelligence (AI). Altair enables organizations in nearly every industry to compete more effectively in a connected world, while creating a more sustainable future. With more than 3,000 engineers, scientists, and creative thinkers in 25 countries, we help solve our customer’s toughest challenges and deliver unparalleled service, helping the innovators innovate, drive better decisions, and turn today’s problems into tomorrow’s opportunities. Our vision is to transform customer decision making with data analytics, simulation, and high-performance computing and artificial intelligence (AI). For more than 30 years, we have been helping our customers integrate electronics and controls with mechanical design to expand product value, develop AI, simulation, and data-driven digital twins to drive better decisions, and deliver advanced HPC and cloud solutions to support unlimited idea exploration. Ready to go? #ONLYFORWARD  At our core we are explorers; adventurers; pioneers. We are the brains behind some of the world’s most revolutionary innovations and are not only comfortable in new and uncharted waters, we dive in headfirst. We are the original trailblazers that make the impossible possible, discovering new solutions to our customer’s toughest challenges. Altair is an equal opportunity employer. Our backgrounds are diverse, and every member of our global team is critical to our success. Altair's history demonstrates a belief that empowering each individual authentic voice reinforces a culture that thrives because of the uniqueness among our team.

About Rivian:     Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.  As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.  Role Summary:     This role fulfills restraint system modeling and optimization requirements for MSP platform. This will include assessments of interior surface proposals by studio, dial in safety requirements for interior safety, work with body structures and safety structures team on structural design strategies and its implications on vehicle pulse and occupant loading criteria (OLC) and work with restraints SMEs and DREs to tune restraints and dial in performance. This role will be highly collaborative in nature with this role cross functionally working across product development towards occupant systems integration. During MSP program, this role will be required to be present frequently onsite at restraints suppliers in Metro Detroit, for design reviews, design/validation discussions, sled/static testing, sled validations and crash testing in Buffalo NY. This role will confirm and validate Safety restraints strategies numerically and propose path forward for restraints safety system integration.  Responsibilities:  Build, correlate and maintain occupant safety CAE models related to FMVSS-201/208/214, UNECE, USNCAP, IIHS, Euro NCAP, China NCAP regulations, component, and system level. Build CAE models for interior components if these models aren’t provided by suppliers. Integrate interior component models such as restraints/seats/cockpit/header/trim/carpet into the systems model. Verify proper behavior of each sub-component model within the CAE system. Ensure proper model organization, model robustness, and run time efficiency. Analyze and optimize restraint system performance for compliance to regulations. Develop pragmatic counter measures for compliance with FMVSS, UNECE, USNCAP, IIHS, Euro NCAP and China NCAP. Work cross-functionally with component/system DRE’s to ensure capturing safety aspects and/or countermeasures into vehicle design. Correlate subsystem/ system CAE models to component level and full system level tests incl. full vehicle level tests. Engage directly with component suppliers in case model revisions are required to achieve performance targets. Closely work with test team to ensure test-setup reflects capturing test objective(s) and any data for model correlation. Update and maintain Rivians test specifications as source for confirmation and validation methodologies. Generate reports and executive summaries for communication as required. Qualifications:  MS in Mechanical or Automotive Engineering required with 5+ years of relevant OEM or TIER1 experience Demonstrable strong LS-Dyna expertise in CAE modeling application of restraint systems, dummy models & full vehicle/restraint/dummy models. Be a self-starter and take initiative to frame and solve occupant performance issues working collaboratively with all stakeholders. Ability to set high level safety targets for occupant safety, restraints, interior IP/trim & related structural components. Hands-on proficiency with common pre- and post-processing tools (such as, ANSA, Primer, LS-PrePost, Hyperworks) Good understanding of overall global safety protocols and regulations Experience with physical testing (component, sled & full vehicle) Experience with correlating CAE models to test outcomes. Excellent ability in presentation & writing reports for documentation, engineering, and senior management communications. This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!  When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.  Job Description: Parsons is now hiring an experienced Mechanical Engineer with a desire to work on large infrastructure projects in the oil and chemical industries. Parsons extensive experience in this field, combined with your engineering knowledge, will propel your career forward with opportunity for advancement with top performance. Training, development and opportunities to work on marquee projects as you and our fast paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, enthusiastic to work in highly flexible, team oriented environment and who have exceptional communication, analytical and organizational skills. In this role, you will perform a variety of engineering tasks by applying standard engineering techniques and analyses within a discipline, which may involve CAE (computer aided engineering)/CAD (computer aided design) applications. Willingness to travel to supplier, client, or construction site locations is expected. What You'll Be Doing: Completes a variety of assignments such as drawings, specifications, and other materials suitable for procurement and construction purposes, utilizing CAE/CAD as applicable Responsible for oversight of 3rd party engineering/design teams, including design reviews, coordination, and making recommendations to owner’s engineering team Prepares standard engineering computations, material quality takeoffs, estimates, surveys, and designs for large industrial projects Reviews design documents produced by other engineering teams for compliance with applicable codes and owner standards Interfaces with vendors to coordinate interfaces and perform acceptance testing Prepares detailed requisitions for equipment and materials Applies requirements of ASME BPVC and API tank standards Complete knowledge and interpretation of code compliance requirements and industry standards for the oil, gas, and chemical industries Participate in risk assessment activities, including PHAs and HAZOPs Performs preliminary design activities including studies and alternatives analysis Reviews supplier drawing submittals and assists in performing technical bid analyses Prepares and issues specifications, data sheets, and other construction documents Provides input and technical guidance to CAD Designer/Drafters, Designers, and lower level Engineers working on the same project Demonstrated ability to work with vendors and contractors, while interfacing with multiple departments, and working with internal customers to manage projects, policies, and procedures Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate What Required Skills You'll Bring: Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering (or related field) and 10+ years of related work experience Experience in large, complex industrial projects including equipment selection and specification, developing and reading P&IDs, control diagrams, and managing equipment lists Experience with complex piping systems, hydraulic analysis, pipe stress analysis, and material selection Experience with PIP standards, ASME, and building codes Experience working on interdisciplinary teams to design new facilities and modifications to existing production facilities Working knowledge of CAD and other PC software packages typically associated with engineering   What Desired Skills You'll Bring: Professional Engineer (PE) License preferred Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Not Applicable/None  This position is part of our Critical Infrastructure team.  For more than 75 years, our experts have designed and delivered the critical infrastructure that connects and protects communities around the world. We work in diverse, collaborative teams, both within the company and with our partners and customers, to plan, design, build, and modernize infrastructure. We take special pride in projects and solutions that improve communities as well as people’s quality of life by promoting economic growth, enhancing mobility, and increasing sustainability and resiliency. Powered by our people, we provide the imagination necessary to support our customers’ visions—and to help them see new possibilities.  We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!  The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates. Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.  We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

Test Engineer III - Contractor: Chief Technical Engineer, Vehicle and Multibody Simulations
column7: Position Overview:     Navistar CAE team has an exciting opportunity for a   Chief Technical Engineer Vehicle and MultibodySimulations position in full vehicle simulation area.  Navistar Structural and MBD team within Navistar Product Validation is accountable for all structural strength, durability, NVH and vehicle dynamic simulations across all our commercial vehicles.  The Chief Technical Engineer will provide technical expertise and leadership in the full vehicle simulation area including full vehicle (MBS, and FEA) simulations for ride, and NVH evaluations as well as loads generation for durability FEA team to use in structural durability simulations. Position is expected to lead cross disciplinary projects and teams, with up to 4 direct reports.  The Chief Technical Engineer will oversee overall support functions for Product Development Engineering and will be responsible for leading the processes, problem solving and implementing solutions to complex and high-risk engineering issues. The individual will Influence technical and regulatory standards bodies, provide proactive strategy around identified opportunities.  Responsibilities:  As an expert in the field, uses professional concepts in developing resolution to critical issues and broad design matters. Works on issues that impact design/selling success or address future concepts, products or technologies. Significantly influences functional strategy; may participate in the development of the product or division strategy. Leads the largest projects/initiatives that have a significant impact upon a complex, global business. Influences the strategy to address internal or external business and regulatory issues. Proactively identifies, defines, and solves the most complex problems that impact product performance and direction of the business. Recognized as an external thought leader within strategic function or discipline and contributing external thought leadership and innovation that influences change and advancement of the industry and/or profession. Achievements include major innovations that change and advance the industry and/or profession. Creates formal networks with key decision makers and serves as external spokesperson for the organization. Exercises wide latitude in determining objectives and approaches to critical assignments. Leads large multidisciplinary projects/initiatives that impact the business on a domestic or international scale. Serve as a critical asset in helping senior management articulate financial and technical strategy. Serve as a critical asset in helping Corporation influence the engineering strategy of key partners. Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 15 years of experience in product design/development or new technologies and/or computer science experience At least 2 years of lead experience   OR  Master’s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 12 years of experience in product design/development or new technologies and/or computer science experience At least 2 years of lead experience   OR  PhD in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 9 years of experience in product design/development or new technologies and/or computer science experience At least 2 years of experience of lead experience Additional Requirements:  Qualified candidates, excluding current Navistar employees, must be legally authorized on an unrestricted basis (US Citizen, Legal Permanent Resident, Refugee or Asylee) to be employed in the United States. Navistar does not anticipate providing employment related work sponsorship for this position (e.g., H-1B status) Desired Skills:  Expertise in Vehicle Dynamics and NVH simulation tools and techniques (ADAMS/SimPack etc.) Preferred Expertise in full vehicle FEA simulation tools and techniques. Preferred Experience in Vehicle dynamics and NVH testing methods. Preferred Expertise in non-linear system behaviors (e.g. shocks, air-springs, rubber mounts, suspension components etc.) Preferred Expertise in truck and/or automotive design and development process.   Preferred:  Experience in design release process Experience in problem solving tools such as 8D, Six-sigma, Lean Proven track record of team leadership and project management Excellent Oral and Written communication skills Experience with working on timing plans and budget planning Experience with formal presentations Leadership – coaching, developing others MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Project Company Overview:     Navistar, Inc. (“Navistar”) is a purpose-driven company, reimagining how to deliver what matters to create more cohesive relationships, build higher-performing teams and find solutions where others don’t.  Based in Lisle, Illinois, Navistar or its subsidiaries and affiliates produce International® brand commercial trucks and engines, IC Bus® brand school and commercial buses, all-makes OnCommand® Connection advanced connectivity services, and Fleetrite®, ReNEWeD® and Diamond Advantage® brand aftermarket parts.  With a history of innovation dating back to 1831, Navistar has more than 14,500 employees worldwide and is part of TRATON SE, a global champion of the truck and transport services industry. Additional information is available at www.Navistar.com.  Accelerating the Impact of Sustainable Mobility:     Visit us at   www.Navistar.com to discover more about our organization  Navistar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.  #ridewithnavistar

Test Engineer III - Contractor: Process Simulation Engineering Manager, Outdoor Product Group
column7: Job Description:    Employer: Techtronic Cordless GP    Title: Process Simulation Engineering Manager, Outdoor Product Group    Location: 100 Innovation Way, Anderson, SC 29621    Job Duties:  Drive new and mature product development through process modeling. Engage in the company’s core consumer product lines, including handheld and benchtop power tools, storage products, outdoor products, and cleaning products. Support current and future programs with process modeling software tools, such as Autodesk Moldflow. Consult with engineers, tooling, and manufacturing personnel to optimize part design, tool design, and processes for injection molded and compression molded parts. Coordinate and develop the complete analysis process by determining techniques, gathering material property data, and dimensional/cosmetic requirements of the part. Make recommendations to improve dimensional stability, strength, and the cosmetic appearance of injection molded parts. Determine the effects of process variables, cooling rates, and residual stresses on structural integrity of plastic parts using CAE structural analysis. Work with long fiber thermoplastics and mineral filled, talc filled and/or glass filled polymers. Effectively communicate findings with Project Engineers, tool shops, molding facilities, and other suppliers to ensure high quality parts. Correlate analytical results to molded parts and reverse engineer problems to replicate in Moldflow to find solutions. Effectively oversee multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring necessary analysis results are delivered on time and parts are properly reviewed for manufacturability. Provide technical guidance to direct reports and other team members, manage technical directions, set priorities, and establish deadlines. Provide training and guidance to team members for career development and learning.   Job Requirements:  Master of Science or equivalent degree in Mechanical Engineering or related engineering field and 5 years of professional experience in plastics injection molding simulation; or a Bachelor of Science or equivalent degree in Mechanical Engineering or related engineering field and 7 years of professional experience in plastics injection molding simulation. Experience must include:    Moldflow analysis related to complex injection molded parts. Altair Hyperworks, Unigraphics/NX, and other pre-processing tools for CAD preparation, mesh generation, and other tasks related to Moldflow model preprocessing. Analysis of unreinforced, mineral-filled, talc-filled, and fiber reinforced thermoset and thermoplastic components, including associated warp and shrink factors. Optimizing gate locations, manifold layout, and cooling systems for injection molding tools utilizing complex actions, including modeling cooling circuits, cooling inserts, and thermal pins for large parts with complex geometries. Validating technologies including compression molding, conformal cooling, 2-shot over-molding, blow molding, and insert molding. Performing root-cause failure analysis and design of experiments to improve dimensional stability and appearance of injection molded parts. Performing structural FEA on plastic components using ANSYS Mechanical, LS-Dyna, or similar software and passing fiber orientation mapping from Moldflow to FEA for structural analysis. Participation in DFM review and collaboration with Design and Project Engineers to ensure manufacturability of plastic parts. Associate, Professional, or Expert level certification for Autodesk Simulation Moldflow software. Up to 10% domestic and 5% international travel required to attend mold tool trials.

Group Description Over 120 years of experience in vehicle production and a broad range of services make Magna Steyr the worldwide leading brand-independent engineering and manufacturing partner for OEMs. Our extensive range of services covers product groups Engineering Services - from systems and modules to complete vehicle engineering - and Complete Vehicle Manufacturing, where we offer World Class flexible solutions from niche to volume production. So far, Magna Steyr has produced more than 4 million vehicles - of 32 different models. Magna Steyr is the ideal automotive contract manufacturer worldwide to produce vehicles with conventional, hybrid and electric powertrains – in some cases, all on the same production line. This further demonstrates the automotive supplier's experience in electrification and electromobility. Role Summary Magna Steyr is looking for a talented team member with experience in Product Quality that will enable this the individual to monitoring quality through all stages of development thereby ensuring adherence to program and industry standards. This would be a passionate individual interested in being involved in developing the next level industry standard for vehicle architecture and production solutions. The position will be responsible to support the Senior Engineering Lead positions within the Magna Steyr North American vehicle engineering activity with a focus on overseeing system, sub-system, and component quality as it relates to fit, form, and functionality as defined by the product technical specifications in support of all program phases (i.e.: concept, production design and engineering, product release, manufacturing, and assembly, etc.). Key Responsibilities      Technical Responsibility      Contribute to the Global Technical Area (GTA) strategy and growth by supporting the Lead Engineering roles and the whole engineering team in areas such as:     Proactive participation and support in APQP documentation creation and maintenance (DVP&R, DFMEA, Etc.)Proactive participation in sourcing documentation definition and developmentCreate work products required for quality assurance such a QA Plan, QA Schedule, Quality Status Reports, Risk Management Plan., and Inspection Fixture LogPlan and moderate reviews with engineering development team for work productsPerform risk management assessments through various phases of product development.Create and maintain review database for part, subsystem, and vehicle audits, dimensional, appearance or functional.Review and ensure end to end traceability across various phases of development life cycle.Organizing and contributing to delivery of work deliverables including functional safety at key quality gate reviews .Review deliverables to ensure ASPICE and/or CMMI complianceContinuously improve QA process by enhancing requirements and process metrics based on lessons learned.Co-ordinating of ASPICE/CMMi gap analysis, reviews, and assessments with the process teamProvide regular updates on assignment progress as it relates to program goals and objectives and key project requirements (KPI’s)Support and contribute to knowledge base of internal and external best practicesParticipate in benchmarking studies and contribute to the benchmark knowledgebaseStay current with industry standards and practices and identify potential areas of continuous Improvement to the team and group leadsRead across production capability data to the GTA’s and confirm Dimensional Engineering inclusion of dataDetermine component and assembly inspection fixtures comprehend the drawing information and Magna standards      Project Planning, Target Achievement, Monitoring & Reporting      Employ knowledge and technical experience to support the engineering development of one or more subsystems     Support the project team(s) engineering in achieving project objectives, performance and cost requirements, and timing milestonesAssist and lead, when assigned, with external support services and resources involved with the project engineering developmentSupport work development packages assigned to third partiesSupport the project senior engineering personnel in meeting program deliverables including, but not limited to, product definition, component design and release, validation, supplier support, launch support, etc. Key Qualifications/Requirements      To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, ability and/or physical demands required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.     Must have a positive “can do” attitudeMust be flexible and able to course correct paths according to priority alignmentShould be team oriented with a focus on striving for the best solutions for the group as a wholeKnowledge of industry quality specifications and test management techniques within the automotive industry is a plusAbility to perform 8-D, 5-Why, Fishbone analysis, FaultTreeAnalysisKnowledge of DFMEA/PFMEA development processProficient computer knowledge and skills, Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)Computer knowledge and skills in CAD and CAE simulation preferredSix Sigma certification preferredProfessional communication skills (written and verbal)Experience with End of Line testing for components and assembliesExperience in EV system assembly and handling preferredExperience in ISO 26262 / ASIL Risk Class, ASPICEFamiliar with CMMI Additional InformationEducation– Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent (Master’s Degree Preferred)At least 8+ years of working experience in Automotive QualityNormal amount of sitting or standing, average mobility to move around an office environment, able to conduct normal amount of work at a computerMay require local, domestic, and international travel – less than 15% domestic + international Awareness. column7: About Rivian:     Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.  As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.  Responsibilities:  Candidate will be responsible for project management and engineering deliverables for development of aluminum and steel wheels, and wheel accessories (wheel covers, caps, fasteners) Design and implement wheel component and systems, integrating with chassis component systems from concept into serial production. Capture vehicle level wheel related requirements & attributes, and deliver against those targets. Seek solutions to technical challenges & problem solve issues arising during the wheel development & in serial production (with tire and assembly) Ensure wheel component and subsystems meet all markets into which Rivian vehicles will be offered. Deliver wheel programs according to Rivian standards and guidelines. Utilize knowledge and experience gained from working within wheel development in conjunction with lean principles to enhance the wheel offering for future vehicles at Rivian. Operate as a standalone role and responsible for owning program specific wheel chassis deliverables (engaging with Lead & Senior Lead Chassis & Vehicle Dynamics Engineers) Create and develop engineering specification packages that effectively communicate to internal and external partners to ensure products meet given project parameters Understand, interpret and ensure tire related local, regional and international homologation requirements are met. Maintain and manage wheel component and vehicle level sub system design verification requirements & testing. Complete and release wheel and/or tire wheel assembly documentation, including 2D drawings Manage designed parts in the virtual environment and support virtual build and release activities Develop collaborative relationships with wheel suppliers & wheel/tire assemblers, and manage them to deliver projects on time and to specification Supporting initial wheel 2D & 3D Themes, working alongside Rivian Studio Engineering and Design Teams; assess wheel design feasibility, monitor wheel attribute targets, offer technical direction on maturing wheel designs into feasible solutions. Working confidently in CATIA 3DX environment performing; assembly, packaging, measurement, surfacing GSD, drawings Evaluating wheel designs with CAE software. Working with nominated wheel supplier after award to develop wheel designs, balancing supplier and studio requirements whilst protecting wheel attribute targets Facilitate regular touchpoints between supplier and studio, whilst managing project schedule Confidently mediate design compromise discussions between studio and supplier. Effectively balance multiple projects, responsibilities, and tasks simultaneously Meet program timing & budget constraints whilst achieving mass, vehicle dynamics, crash, aero, NVH and chassis attribute targets Define validation procedures to ensure only optimized, integrated and robust designs are released Travel as necessary to support testing, supplier visits & production engineering support Qualifications:  Minimum Bachelor’s degree (Automotive, Mechanical or Motorsport engineering) and 3 years experience wheel design and/or development experience required at Wheel Supplier or OEM or Minimum Master’s degree (Automotive, Mechanical or Motorsport engineering) and 1 years experience wheel design and/or development experience required at Wheel Supplier or OEM Must be familiar with DFMEA/DVPR usage and review of these documents Strong experience using CAD (ideally CATIA V6) required Solid fundamental knowledge of chassis design, vehicle dynamics, wheel & tire alignment, tire uniformity and tire design contributors to vehicle level performance Understanding of wheel & tire design standards & code (ETRTO, TR&A etc) & homologation Candidates should be self-motivated and able to work in a fast-paced team environment Candidates should have the ability to manage multiple wheel projects at the same time Excellent communication skills, able to interact effectively with domestic and international teammates & suppliers Must be a self-starter, use initiative and engineering judgement Ability to interpret data and solve complex problems using first principles Pay Disclosure:     Salary range for California Based Applicants: $121,000-$139,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, location, and other factors permitted by law).  Benefits Summary: Rivian provides robust medical/Rx, dental and vision insurance packages for full-time employees, their spouse or domestic partner, and children up to age 26. Coverage is effective on the first day of employment, and Rivian covers most of the premiums.  Company Statements:  Equal Opportunity   Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com.  Candidate Data Privacy   Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.  Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.  Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions. Saratoga, CAE-Space US – Space Systems Engineering /Full-Time/ On-Site     Ready to make connectivity from space universally accessible, secure and actionable? Then you’ve come to the right place!        E-Space is bridging Earth and space to enable hyper-scaled deployments of space-powered Internet of Things (IoT) solutions and services. We are fundamentally changing the design, economics, manufacturing, coverage limitations and service delivery associated with traditional satellite and terrestrial IoT systems.        By building a highly-advanced low Earth orbit (LEO) space system—with a unique antenna design, highly sustainable spacecraft system and low-cost, small portable end-user devices—we can extend global satellite coverage, capacity and connectivity beyond legacy space services to provide a new kind of IoT platform that lets users sense, track, connect and act on information gathered, anywhere.        We’re intentional, we’re unapologetically curious and we’re 100% committed to saving space, protecting our planet and turning connectivity into actionable intelligence.    What is the role: As a Senior AIT Engineer, you will participate in the E-Space satellite assembly integration and testing (AIT) activities. As part of the E-Space AIT team, you will have the opportunity to test thousands of flight hardware units and directly contribute to the success of an innovative satellite architecture on-orbit.    This position is based in Saratoga, CA.    What you will do: Spacecraft sub-system acceptance: Organize the acceptance of the spacecraft sub-systems before integration to the flatsat (EM), or to the satellite structure (FM) EM flatsat activities:Define the Verification and Validation (V&V) requirements for the activityGSE definition and procurementSatellite procedure creation and execution on the flatsatResult collectionV&V requirement Statement of Compliance Participate in the spacecraft unit qualification test campaigns. FM AIT activities:GSE definition and procurementSatellite procedure creation and execution on the FM SpacecraftResult collectionV&V requirement statement of complianceFM Satellite environmental test Campaign What you bring to this role: Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering 7+ years of experience in spacecraft engineering Previous experience with a satellite AIT campaign Good understanding of spacecraft subsystem development, having been involved in the development of at least one Understanding of electrical test equipment, test procedures, data acquisition systems and instrumentation Experience in environmental testing such as vibration, shock, thermal and TVAC Programming experience in Python, MATLAB/Simulink Demonstrated success working in a dynamic environment Bonus points: Experience with radiation effects testing Project/program management skills     $100,000 - $170,000 a year    The estimated range is meant to reflect an anticipated salary range for the position in question, which is based on market data and other factors, all of which are subject to change. Individual pay is based on location, skills and expertise, depth of relevant experience, and other relevant factors. For questions about this, please speak to the recruiter if you decide to apply for the role and are selected for an interview.     We are redefining how satellites are designed, manufactured and used—so we’re looking for candidates with passion, deep knowledge and direct experience on LEO satellite component development, design and in-orbit activities. If that’s your experience – then we’ll be immediately wow-ed.    Why E-Space is right for you: We want you to make the most of your journey at E-Space. That’s why we support and invest in the physical, emotional and financial well-being of our team members and their families. Some of what you can expect when working at E-Space:    An opportunity to really make a differenceSustainability at our coreFair and honest workplaceInnovative thinking is encouragedCompetitive salariesContinuous learning and developmentHealth and wellness care optionsFinancial solutions for the future Optional legal services (US only)Paid holidaysPaid time off

If you are an experienced DESIGN ENGINEER looking for a chance to grow, Copeland has an opportunity for you! Based in our Sidney, OH office, supporting our Climate Technologies Division. The Senior Design Engineer will support NPD projects within the Commercial Air conditioning group. As a Design Engineer, you will have a high  responsibility for engineering design, technical modeling, and analysis, including technical calculations and analysis, preparation or CAD/CAE models, detail and assembly drawings, design layouts (product BOM), tolerance application, and leading design of new development products. This role will also include team leadership, peer mentoring, and responsibility for technological analysis, priority planning, problem-solving, and delivery of quality design outputs. As a Senior Design Engineer, You Will: Apply basic and advanced mechanical sciences to perform design analysis of products and components, including static/dynamic analysis, the strength of materials, material selection, and design optimization. Utilize state-of-the-art design technologies, computational systems, design standards, and rapid prototype methodologies. Establish and document component and assembly specifications, including the definition of required geometry, materials, allowable tolerances, and related manufacturing processes. Lead project teams to develop and document designs as well as specifications that meet the requirements of the product performance and program charter. Create and verify the accuracy and consistency of engineering drawings and CAD/CAE models in accordance with corporate engineering standards and ASME14.5 Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerance requirements. Create, direct, and review advanced design layouts of compressor assemblies, sub-systems, and components to establish spatial requirements, fit-up, and relationship of components to ensure the functionality of design intent. Verify design intent by checking proper fit-up of components using CAD and tolerance stack-up analysis methods. Produce and utilize engineering calculations and operate computer programs to support design analysis and engineering efforts, including spreadsheets and internet resources. Provide support to engineering labs, manufacturing facilities, Supplier Quality, Procurement. and Advanced Manufacturing Lead design efforts in global collaboration with peer engineering facilities to develop product designs jointly, promote consistent design practices, and check global design project elements to ensure the project’s design intent. Perform as team leader and peer mentor to facilitate the development and advancement of the engineering group. Required Education, Experience & Skills: Bachelor's degree in Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience. Minimum of five years design experience with rotating machinery or relevant industry experience. Experience producing CAD models for design layouts, assemblies, sub-assemblies and components as well as technical drawings for prototype and production components. Experience with 3D CAD software such as Siemens NX9.0, SolidWorks or Pro/E. Legal authorization to work in the United States - Sponsorship will not be provided for this role Preferred Education, Experience & Skills: Seven plus years relevant experience FEA, CFD or other analysis. Proven track record of innovative and patentable ideas Knowledge of common manufacturing processes and techniques used to produce high volume production components Knowledge of common processes used in producing prototype components and fixtures Knowledge and experience within HVAC Industry. Experience using Teamcenter database software  Flexible Work Schedule – Remote Work Option and Core Hours This role has the flexibility of a remote work option up to two days a week and a core hour schedule. You can choose to flex your start and stop times given you are working during the core hours of 9:00am - 3:00pm. Our teams work together to ensure our chosen work schedules enable our creativity and productivity as we serve the needs of our customers.” #LI-AF1Our Commitment to Our People Across the globe, we are united by a singular Purpose: Sustainability is no small ambition. That’s why everything we do is geared toward a sustainable future—for our generation and all those to come. Through groundbreaking innovations, HVACR technology and cold chain solutions, we are reducing carbon emissions and improving energy efficiency in spaces of all sizes, from residential to commercial to industrial. Our employees are our greatest strength. We believe that our culture of passion, openness, and collaboration empowers us to work toward the same goal - to make the world a better place. We invest in the end-to-end development of our people, beginning at onboarding and through senior leadership, so they can thrive personally and professionally. Flexible and competitive benefits plans offer the right options to meet your individual/family needs: medical insurance plans, dental and vision coverage, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, and more. We provide employees with flexible time off plans, including paid parental leave (maternal and paternal), vacation and holiday leave. Together, we have the opportunity – and the power – to continue to revolutionize the technology behind air conditioning, heating and refrigeration, and cultivate a better future. Learn more about us and how you can join our team! Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion At Copeland, we believe having a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment is critical to our success. We are committed to creating a culture where every employee feels welcomed, heard, respected, and valued for their experiences, ideas, perspectives and expertise. Ultimately, our diverse and inclusive culture is the key to driving industry-leading innovation, better serving our customers and making a positive impact in the communities where we live. Work Authorization Copeland will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1 with OPT or CPT, H-1, H-2, L-1, B, J or TN, or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire. Equal Opportunity Employer Copeland is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status. We are committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment. If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com. About Copeland We are a global climate technologies company engineered for sustainability. We create sustainable and efficient residential, commercial and industrial spaces through HVACR technologies. We protect temperature-sensitive goods throughout the cold chain. And we bring comfort to people globally. Best-in-class engineering, design and manufacturing combined with category-leading brands in compression, controls, software and monitoring solutions result in next-generation climate technology that is built for the needs of the world ahead. Whether you are a professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring your first opportunity, or recent graduate with an advanced degree, we have opportunities that will allow you to innovate, be challenged and make an impact. Join our team and start your journey today! No calls or agency requests please.

Test Engineer III - Contractor: Staff Mechanical Design Engineer, Structural Design, Semi
column7: What to Expect  A Structures Design Engineer is responsible for engineering best-in-class body structure architectures and systems for Tesla’s premium vehicle programs. You will Conceptualize, Design, Engineer, Release, Develop and Launch Body Structure components and systems. What You’ll Do  Create and develop Body-in-White components, system requirements and specifications to achieve best-in-class structural, NVH and crash performance from conceptualization to mass production Create vehicle-aligned component and system targets for function, cost, weight and investment Establish system architecture and functional feasibility Optimize the concepts and designs with analytical and physical assessments, ensuring conformation to federal regulations governing assigned systems Deliver world-class craftsmanship and fit/finish through the proper implementation of GD&T Interface with Tesla and Supplier manufacturing to develop components that are optimized for the production environment Create component and subsystem design verification plans and test methods Develop design concepts and production designs in both CATIA V5 and CATIA V6 Release parts for production in the PLM system What You’ll Bring  Bachelor of Science or higher in mechanical engineering, experience and evidence of exceptional ability, or equivalent 7 years minimum experience in structural design engineering Experience in a development life cycle with substantial system responsibility Proficiency in computer aided design. CATIA experience preferred. Understanding of GD&T in design engineering Demonstrated knowledge and ability to integrate state-of-the-art design and manufacturing methods into product concepts and designs Well versed in selecting materials based on their properties and manufacturing limitations Proven knowledge and application of engineering fundamentals to root cause and solve complex engineering challenges Demonstrated ability to manage projects with tight timing constraints Knowledge of metal parts manufacturing methods Ability to thrive with ambiguity in design direction and conditions Experience in design for six sigma highly preferred Ability to interpret CAE results and integrate recommendations into product designs

Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility   At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.    We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.    Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.  Lucid Motors is seeking an experienced and highly skilled professional to fill the position of Director of Body Structures and Closures. This is an opportunity to help shape the future of electric vehicles atone of the world’s leading innovators in electric vehicle technologies.  The ideal candidate will be a highly experienced engineer and leader with exceptional understanding of technical fundamentals, and an instinct for building high performing teams of industry-leading experts. As the Director, you will oversee concept design, engineering execution, and innovation activities in the field of body structures, closures, body sealing, CAE simulation, and advanced manufacturing techniques. Responsibilities: Lead and manage the body structure team, providing guidance, mentorship, and support to ensure successful execution of projects related to BIW, Closures, body sealing, and their associated engineering activities. Oversee the engineering of Body in White and Closures, including design, development, validation, and integration, ensuring compliance with industry standards, performance objectives, and cost targets. Drive the engineering of body sealing, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to develop lightweight, safe, and efficient solutions that optimize performance and range. Utilize CAE-simulation techniques to analyze and optimize the performance of body structures, closures, and body sealing, ensuring structural integrity, crashworthiness, and overall vehicle performance. Collaborate with manufacturing engineering teams to develop advanced manufacturing processes and techniques for efficient and high-quality production of body structures and closures. Foster a culture of continuous improvement, innovation, and excellence within the team, encouraging employees to think creatively, learn quickly, and strive for perfection in a fast-paced environment. Collaborate closely with other directors and stakeholders across the organization, including design, electrical engineering, vehicle dynamics, and quality assurance, to ensure seamless integration of body structures and closures within the overall vehicle architecture. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in engineering required. Masters or similarly advanced degree in materials, mechanical engineering, or related field preferred. 10+ years of experience in automotive body structures and closures engineering, with a focus on electric vehicles and advanced materials. Strong technical expertise in body attributes, structural analysis, and CAE-simulation techniques. Proven track record of successfully leading and managing cross-functional engineering teams, preferably in the automotive industry. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to make sound engineering decisions in a complex and dynamic environment. Strong project management skills, including the ability to prioritize tasks, manage budgets, and deliver projects on schedule. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams and influence key stakeholders. Demonstrated passion for electric vehicles, sustainable transportation, and the pursuit of excellence in the automotive industry. Familiarity with industry regulations, standards, and best practices related to body structures, and closures. Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors. California (Bay Area) - $192,000-$275,000 Lucid maintains your privacy according to its Candidate Privacy Notice. If you are a California resident, please refer to our California Candidate Privacy Notice.    At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.  To all recruitment agencies:   Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Test Engineer III - Contractor: Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer, Geartrain, Drive Systems
column7: What to Expect  Geartrain Design Engineers in Tesla’s Drive Systems Engineering Team are responsible for design, release and launch of the geartrain components for Tesla vehicle product lines. You will be part of the team that creates and executes world-class drive units in terms of performance, cost, and manufacturability. Components of particular importance include gears, bearings, shafts, clutches, couplers, actuators, differentials and integration of these components. What You’ll Do  Develop concepts for geartrain related components to minimize part count, cost, and complexity in the drive unit Geartrain system design utilizing parametric modeling to evaluate performance trade-offs Geartrain component design of rotating shafts, torque split devices, couplings, and clutches Design, coordinate, and execute system level and component level tests for performance, durability, reliability, and variability CAE analysis (static, modal, fatigue, topology optimization) Matlab/Simulink/Simscape modeling 2D and 3D modeling utilizing CAD software Supplier coordination for high volume contract manufacturing Work with world class experts in firmware, design, and test engineering to develop and bring innovative technologies to mass production Mentor entry-level engineers and interns in the team What You’ll Bring  Experience in rotating machinery design Understanding of bearings, gears and gearbox lubrication Experience with differentials, actuators, clutches, axle disconnect systems or multi-speed transmissions Deep understanding of ANSI Y14.5 Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing application to part drawings and function Expert in 3D modeling within a product development environment. CATIA preferred Experience in CAE analysis software package like Ansys, Abaqus, Hyperworks Experience of launching automotive designs from concept through release and production or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability

Test Engineer III - Contractor: Senior Engineer* – Quality Assurance and Testing
column7: Diese Stellenanzeige ist nicht in deutscher Sprache verfügbar.The main purpose of PERI’s Senior Engineer – Quality Assurance & Testing (SEQAT) position, is to introduce new products for the North America market. The SEQAT does this by being accountable for new product development activities relating to the design for manufacture, quality of manufacture and application approvals. Leveraging PERI’s resources, the SEQAT ensures product requirements and quality standards are satisfied to PERI and industry standards. In addition, it is the responsibility of the SEQAT position to provide continuing support for manufacturing, application engineering, testing, CAPA, and product documentation.Your responsibilitiesResponsible for product project management from prototype to full production based upon accurate project schedules and budgetsPerform research and testing on product concepts, new, and present test results to PERI teamCoordinate with manufacturing or suppliers at suitable stages, such as at initial design, to evaluate the design’s suitability for manufacturing in an efficient and UnternehmensinfoMit einem Umsatz von 1.864 Mio. € im Jahr 2022 ist PERI international einer der größten Hersteller und Anbieter von Schalungs- und Gerüstsystemen. Das Familienunternehmen mit Stammsitz in Weißenhorn (Deutschland) bedient mit rund 9.100 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern, über 60 Tochtergesellschaften und deutlich mehr als 160 Lagerstandorten seine Kunden mit innovativen Systemgeräten und umfangreichen Serviceleistungen rund um die Schalungs- und Gerüsttechnik.

Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility   At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.    We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.    Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.  We are currently seeking a Sr. Restraint System Design Release Engineer. This position requires an experienced professional in restraint system development. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.  Speciality in Seatbelts and airbags preferred. Role Be responsible for the design release of all airbags, and/or seatbelts and their integration in the vehicle, from system specification development, sourcing, packaging, drawing release, design validation, sub-system integration to ramp up and manufacturing support Work closely with the design studio and interior engineering teams to develop the optimum restraint system packages for occupant protection performance and interior styling Manage Tier 1 suppliers for both engineering development and program timing. Manage validation plan and tests labs for sub-system integration. Function as the main point of contact for all Restraints supplier interfaces. Provide expertise on restraint system design to ensure five-star safety ratings for our new vehicles. Work closely with CAE team to provide design inputs and utilize CAE results to optimize the component design Support crash tests and vehicle homologation. Make sure parts are supplied with right pedigrees for all crash test vehicles and other vehicle level validation and homologation needs Note: Sub-system means the Airbag together with the host component, like PAB and KAB in IP, SAB in seat, CAB in roof rail, etc… Qualifications In-depth knowledge about the design and engineering of airbags and/or seat belts systems, direct experience in automotive OEM or Tier 1 suppliers Knowledge of automotive crashworthiness legislation and attributes Knowledge of latest technology advancement in the field of passive safety Enough CAD skills to package the component models into vehicle models, check interfaces with the rest of the vehicle and make small modifications if necessary. The ideal candidate should possess enough CAD skills to design small brackets, fixtures, etc. Engineering fundamentals in problem-solving Advantageous Experience in program management Experience in testing (crash, airbag deployment, seats, IP and/or upper trims) Knowledge of CAE analysis and restraint system integration and optimization The ability to articulate highly technical issues to audiences not in the crash safety field, such as top management, design studio, purchasing team, etc. Excellent people skills to manage suppliers, push the envelope to develop optimal technical solutions, ensure timely delivery of all components High ethics Education Bachelor’s degree and above in Mechanical Engineering or other related fields Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors.  California (Bay Area) - $115,000 - $165,000 Additional Compensation and Benefits: Lucid offers a wide range of competitive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, vacation, and 401k. The successful candidate may also be eligible to participate in Lucid’s equity program and/or a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing such programs. (Cash or equity incentive awards, if any, will depend on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and company performance.)
