column7: Responsibilities: Design complex RF and Microwave components, circuits, systems, and printed circuit boards, utilizing design software tools such as CAE and CAD. Devote a significant portion of time in developing necessary electrical engineering system and testing and analyzing its acquisition system performance. Design and develop phase locked loop circuits and synthesizers and VCO’s (voltage controlled oscillators). Research and design fractional-N fast-switching synthesizers, write test software and procedures for the test equipment to test the fractional-N synthesizers. Utilize personal initiative, maintain both formal and informal technical training, and focus on developing the next test equipment generation based on the latest available electrical technologies. Possess proficient electrical engineering and/or electronic engineering skills along with a body of highly-specialized knowledge that will be applied to contributing to existing technical information. Use integration protocols and methodologies to ensure that SMC’s integration design protocols do not become obsolete, given the rapid technological advances in the field. Utilize sound knowledge of CAD methods and hands-on experience in all synthesizer related fields (CAD, PCB, detail circuits, relevant programming). Perform circuit and component analysis and simulations using industry ADS, HFSS and other CAD tools. Identify and establish performance standards and verify and validate designs through simulations, tests and reliability studies.Qualifications:Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering plus two years of engineering experience. Require expertise in using Software: LabVIEW, TestStand, XML, XPath, Version One, ClearCase, ClearQuest. Must have proof of legal authority to work in the United States. If you are interested and qualified for this position, you can send us a copy of your resume via e-mail, mail or fax. Resumes sent through E-mail must be in MS Word or PDF format.E-mail: hrd@synergymwave.com  Fax : (973) 881-8361  Mailing Address:  Synergy Microwave Corporation  201 McLean Blvd., Paterson, NJ 07504

JBT AeroTech Corporation, an Oshkosh Corporation (NYSE:OSK) company, is a leading provider of aviation ground support products, gate equipment and airport services to commercial airlines, airports, air-freight carriers, ground handling and military customers. Like Oshkosh, JBT AeroTech offers products that make a difference in people’s lives by supporting those in our communities who do some of the toughest work. They own many of the most trusted brands in the air transportation industry, including LEKTRO®, JetAire®, JetPower®, AmpTekÔ, Jetway®, and more.    Job Summary    The Senior Hydraulic/Fluid Power Engineer will work closely with Management, Engineers, and Designers to prepare and lead designs of a complex nature. The Senior Hydraulic Engineer will be responsible for designing hydraulic systems for heavy mobile equipment to meet the requirements for customer options of current production and/or new product development. The Senior Hydraulic Engineer performs complex analysis of designs and prepares supporting documentation. The Senior Hydraulic Engineer plans, develops, coordinates and communicates schedules of projects, and works with other departments and personnel at all levels to complete assigned tasks.    Essential Duties & Responsibilities  Read, interpret, and prepare applicable technical information & suggest design/process changes to ensure safe, simple, functional, and cost-effective results Demonstrate ability to independently create safe, functional, and cost-effective designs that meet complex specification requirements Conduct and lead prototype and product testing at the component and subsystem level. Assist with software/control systems testing and validation Conduct and lead design reviews Work independently under minimal supervision; equally capable of leading or working with cross-functional design teams Rely on experience & judgment to plan & accomplish assigned goals Operate with broad latitude for independent creative work Lead medium-sized engineering projects and design efforts Assist and mentor less experienced Engineers, Designers, and Drafters Plan own daily and weekly activities and report on progress; responsible for personal and project schedule attainment Utilize advanced CAD/CAE skills to prepare designs and documentation Assist drafters and designers in developing the design of products using drafting tools or computer-assisted design (CAD) or drafting equipment and software Creation and revisions of Schematics and installation drawings Work closely with other engineering disciplines and supports manufacturing to resolve production problems Responsible for selecting vendors and specifying components; actively supports sourcing efforts Work with vendors on new component requirements or component failures Actively interact with customers at a high level of expertise Actively support Manufacturing, Field Service and Customer needs Investigate equipment failures and difficulties to diagnose faulty operation both in facility and at customer or vendor sites Demonstrate understanding and application of Value-Added Value Engineering activities Demonstrate understanding of Lean Manufacturing and Design principles Work consist of a mix of both office and manufacturing environments No direct reports Travel up to 15% of time Other projects and responsibilities may be added at the company’s discretion   Qualifications  Bachelor of Science in Engineering with a minimum of 7+ years relevant engineering experience or Master of Science in Engineering and minimum of 5 years relevant engineering experience Manufacturing related experience preferred Working knowledge of heavy mobile equipment Demonstrated working ability with high level 3D CAD modeling system and PLM system Experience with Siemens NX and Teamcenter preferred Proven communication skills Ability to work in a hybrid environment with a minimum of 40% of time in office and up to 100% as needed Manufacturing and Test environments will require ability and knowledge of installation of components, setting adjustments, and data collection and the ability to operate units when properly trained. Ability to work productively and cohesively in a diverse and multicultural environment   Additional Training:  In-house training on AeroTech product operation and training In-house training on AeroTech work instructions and work aids Various software packages as required Unigraphics NX and Teamcenter applications   Specialized Knowledge, Equipment, and Applications:  Expert understanding of relevant engineering principles Strong understanding of mobile equipment design criteria Knowledge of Geometric Dimension and Tolerance (GD&T) Knowledge of MRP/ERP systems and bills of material Strong knowledge of PC operations and Microsoft Office products Systems — Knowledge of complex machines and tools, including their designs, uses, repair, and maintenance Production and Processing — Knowledge of raw materials, production processes, quality control, costs, and other techniques for maximizing the effective manufacturing and distribution of goods Mathematics — Strong analytical ability required. Ability to apply advanced mathematical principals to analyze and solve issues Language Skills — Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, technical journals, regulatory documents, customer specifications and other relevant documents. Ability to write reports, business correspondence and procedures. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from internal and external customers. Ability to meet performance goals and objectives Time management skills (Emphasis on planning and organizing assigned projects) Ability to estimate and track cost implications of projects Capable of complex analytical reasoning   Oshkosh is committed to working with and offering reasonable accommodation to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to disability for any part of the employment process, please contact us at: 920-502-3009 or corporatetalentacquisition@oshkoshcorp.com.    Oshkosh Corporation is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. This company will provide equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Information collected regarding categories as provided by law will in no way affect the decision regarding an employment application.    Oshkosh Corporation will not discharge or in any manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with Oshkosh Corporation's legal duty to furnish information.    Certain positions with Oshkosh Corporation require access to controlled goods and technologies subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations or the Export Administration Regulations. Applicants for these positions may need to be "U.S. Persons," as defined in these regulations. Generally, a "U.S. Person" is a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident, or an individual who has been admitted as a refugee or granted asylum.

Test Engineer III - Contractor: Aero Thermal Management, Cooling Systems Design Expert
column7: Established in 1969, TAT Technologies (“TAT”) is a fast-growing profitable provider of aerospace thermal management, power and actuation products and repair services. TAT is a strategic global partner to leading players in the aerospace industry and specializes in providing innovative commercial, defense, OEM and repair/overhaul solutions. Our experience, flexibility, and commitment to meeting customer’s requirements have positioned us to be a trusted partner to some of the world’s leading aircraft manufacturers, OEM’s, airlines, MRO’s, air forces and defense organizations. TAT employs more than 600 employees’ worldwide, with facilities in the US, Israel, and Russia.Adopting a global approach to R&D by linking R&D strategy to the company’s overall business strategy, TAT decided to move its main R&D activities from Israel the US, but in the process, lost most of its R&D capabilities. We are building a brand-new R&D team faced with the challenge of developing innovative products, supporting ongoing contracts, and developing procedures, methodologies, design tools, setting standards, etc. JOB SUMMARY:As a Cooling Systems Design Expert, you will work as part of our newly created R&D team and will be responsible for the development of the company’s cooling systems design capabilities. You will lead and perform the cooling systems design and provide support for all company projects from concept to production. Your ability to be creative and innovative and use design tools for the development of traditional and new generation cooling systems will be crucial to enabling our company to diversify its products portfolio and strengthen its position as a leader in providing the most advanced thermal solutions to our aerospace customers.ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Lead the cooling systems activities for R&D projects and support ongoing and new Engineering contracts.In charge of developing the cooling systems design capabilities and infrastructure (design tools, design analysis tools, design procedures, design manual, streamline processes, etc.).Support the R&D director in fostering a strong collaboration between R&D and business development, to effectively bridge the gap between technological innovation and market opportunities, leading to the successful development and commercialization of cooling systems that meet customer needs and drive business growth.In charge of creating a state-of-the-art testing laboratory for testing cooling systems – Lead all steps for lab creation, including defining objectives and Scope, identifying requirements, allocating space, acquiring equipment, installing infrastructure, designing test setups, developing test procedures, calibration and instrumentation, safety measures, staff training, documentation and reporting, continuous improvement.In charge of designing and developing cooling systems based on project requirements, technical specifications, and industry standard (analyze cooling load requirements, select appropriate cooling technologies, and create system layouts). This includes performing heat transfer calculations and analysis to determine the cooling capacity required for a given system and selecting and specifying various components required for the cooling system, such as compressors, heat exchangers, fans, pumps, and control devices. In charge of supervising the construction of cooling system prototypes and conducting performance tests to verify their functionality, efficiency, reliability, and safety, as well as, analyzing test data and making necessary adjustments or improvements to optimize system performance.In charge of Cooling System Integration by collaborating with other engineering teams (such as mechanical, electrical, and control engineers), as well as customers’ engineering teams to integrate cooling systems into larger projects or products. You must ensure that the cooling system interfaces correctly with other subsystems and meets overall project requirements.In charge of Troubleshooting and Maintenance: you must diagnose and resolve issues related to cooling system performance, efficiency, or reliability. If required by customers, you must conduct regular inspections, preventive maintenance, and repairs to ensure optimal operation of cooling systems throughout their lifecycle.In charge of Documentation and Compliance: You must prepare technical specifications, system documentation, and operational manuals. You must ensure that the cooling systems comply with relevant aerospace & defense industry standards, safety regulations, and environmental requirements.In charge of Continuous Improvement: You must stay updated with the latest advancements in cooling technologies, industry trends, and energy efficiency standards. You must identify opportunities for improvement, propose innovative solutions, and optimize existing cooling systems for enhanced performance and reduced energy consumption.Investigate cutting-edge technology that can help the company develop state-of-the art product solutions and improve efficiency and productivity.Collaborate with cross-functional teams, suppliers, manufacturing, testing, and validation teams on the complete life cycle of the company projects.Continuously monitor relevant regulatory requirements and evaluate their impact on the Company's products.Top of FormRequirements QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS:PhD or Master of Science in Aero-Thermal Engineering / Aerospace EngineeringStrong knowledge of thermodynamics and fluid dynamics principles needed for designing effective cooling systems. Must master heat transfer mechanisms, fluid flow, pressure drop calculations, and the behavior of different cooling mediums (e.g., gas, liquid, refrigerants).Expertise of cooling systems’ components, such as heat exchangers, radiators, fans, pumps, compressors, control valves. etc. (must master factors like heat dissipation requirements, space limitations, cost-effectiveness, and environmental considerations).Strong knowledge in computer simulations and modeling techniques to analyze and optimize cooling system performance. This involves creating mathematical models, conducting simulations, running DOE optimizations, and evaluating different design alternatives to identify the most efficient configurations.Strong knowledge of various materials and manufacturing processes used in the production of cooling system components (good knowledge of factors such as corrosion resistance, thermal conductivity, durability, and cost when selecting materials and processes).Expertise in designing and conducting experiments or tests to validate the performance and reliability of the cooling systems (use of instruments to measure temperature, pressure, and flow rates and analyze the collected data to verify the system's effectiveness). Strong and effective communication and collaboration skills required to work in multidisciplinary teams, interacting with other engineers, project managers, suppliers, and clients (clear communication helps ensure that the cooling system design meets the desired specifications and requirements).Regulatory Compliance: Must consider and comply with the aerospace & defense industry standards, regulations, and safety guidelines (such as FAA, FAR, DFAR, ITAR, etc.). Must ensure that the cooling system design meets all necessary requirements and specifications, including environmental regulations and energy efficiency standards. Must be passionate about technology, innovation and discovering creative and cost-effective cooling systems 15+ years in the field of Cooling Systems & Aero-Thermal ManagementExtensive experience in the design, development, and testing of all thermal control systems for aerospace & defense applications, including HVAC for cockpit, thermal management systems for battery systems, and cooling systems required for other flying vehicles components Highly skilled in using engineering principles and CAD and CAE software to conceptualize, design, and develop efficient and reliable cooling solutions.Must possess a combination of technical expertise, problem-solving skills, and creativity to develop innovative cooling solutions that optimize performance, reliability, and energy efficiency. Benefits TAT Technologies offers competitive compensation, including Health Insurance and a 401K plan. It is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).

We heard you knock!Masonite is a leading global designer, manufacturer, marketer and distributor Residential and Commercial doors, high-performance door frames and door system components for the new construction as well as repair, renovation, and remodeling sectors. Since 1925, it has provided its customers with innovative products and superior service at compelling values. As a pioneering door manufacturer catering to both residential and commercial markets, it is embarking on an exciting venture by investing in consumer driven innovation to deliver on its commitment of Doors That Do More™ strategy that addresses human needs for comfort, security, style, and convenience.Product Engineering function within Masonite Innovation Center tackles complex, global product and manufacturing challenges. This position presents a unique opportunity to be part of a rapidly growing team within an industry-leading innovative company and seeks candidates who thrive in a dynamic, start-up-like environment – Inspiring/guiding multidisciplinary team, driving innovation and efficiency in product development process.As Subject-Matter Expert and Technical/scientist partner to VP of Product Engineering, this role is crucial in providing Technology Leadership for new product development/engineering of interior/exterior doors, door-frames, systems and components, manufacturing procedures and process development. Leveraging strategic partnerships with external collaborators/suppliers as well as internal partners, the senior staff engineer is expected to lead front-end innovation, new product development, as well as drive operational excellence while staying stays abreast of new technology, code/compliance requirements, novel materials, process innovation including leading the implementation of best-in-class engineering practices.Responsibilities:Accountable for leading and delivering on strategic business initiatives viz., Innovation, Growth, Sustaining/Operational Excellence across Interior/Exterior Doors, Door-Systems and Components including Value-capture via IP, Technical reports, EMS documentation.Lead all aspects of the product development lifecycle from ideation to detailed design, specification, analysis, and verification – Product design and engineering, material selection, product performance testing/modeling, manufacturing process assessment, prototyping, VA/VE initiatives as well as competitive assessment.Take a hands-on approach in all facets of systems/components design, including requirements analysis, implementation, integration, and validation – Identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure smooth project execution.Provide technical assistance, develop engineering proposals/project charters and Installation guidelines; At SimuTech Group, we truly believe that we are driving innovation and changing the world through the power of engineering simulation. Our growing team of energetic, tech savvy professionals work hard every day to inspire our clients to push the boundaries of innovation and deliver transformational products. If you are motivated and driven by a culture where excellent work ethic and passion are rewarded, then a career with SimuTech Group may be for you! Looking for your next career move? Help today’s engineers build tomorrow’s products by providing solutions and guidance with the power of simulation. We are looking for a Mechanical Engineer with 8 to 10 years of experience to join our world-class FEA Support and Consulting team! This position would be based out of either SimuTech office in Rochester, NY, or Everett, WA. For the right candidate, a remote position can be accommodated elsewhere in the US. The right candidate will become a key member of our technical staff, working in an exciting and challenging technical environment. Success of the Mechanical Engineer will be measured by helping grow SimuTech’s FEA business and developing your own technical skills by solving challenging problems in a wide variety of industries. Each member of our staff is a FEA expert who also maintains expertise in one or more specialized fields. Many of our engineers hold advanced degrees with extensive experience in the engineering consulting business. We maintain a high level of professionalism in a friendly, cooperative, flexible environment. Location: Flexible Essential Job Functions/Accountabilities: The Mechanical Engineer will use software such as ANSYS Mechanical and Mechanical APDL to provide: 1. Technical Support - Provide Support to end users of ANSYS by phone, e-mail, or in person. 2. Pre-sales Support - Work with our account managers to determine the customer's software needs, answer customer technical questions during the sales process and provide software demos/presentations on a variety of subjects. 3. Consulting Work with customers to determine their analysis requirements and expectations. Develop quotes/proposals by determining scopes, costs, and schedules Perform all aspects of analysis (Meshing, Load Cases, Solving, Post Processing, Conclusions) Work with customers to propose alternative design ideas Write analysis reports and other technical documents requested by the customer 4. Technical Training - Teach ANSYS classes at client sites, on-line, and in SimuTech offices across the U.S. and Canada Desired Skills/Experience: Non-Negotiable Hiring Criteria: Must be permanently authorized to work in the US Professional appearance and presentation required. Proficient in Microsoft Office. Must be able to work well in a group and independently. Excellent English-based communication skills, technical writing and verbal skills required. Documented industry experience with enterprise level finite element analysis tools Ansys (preferred). Abacus, Nastran, Altair, etc. Ability to communicate with customers on a technical pre-sales basis to help drive software and services sales Demonstrates creative problem-solving and strong analytical skills Solid theoretical background in structural mechanics and numerical methods backed up by real-world, production-level experience Documented experience (as evidenced by industry experience and/or publications in reputable journals) in:             Structural linear and non-linear static implicit analysis methods (non-linear materials including plasticity and hyper elasticity as well as contact and large strain/large deformation) Implicit dynamics including linear (modal, harmonic, response spectrum, random vibration) and thermal analysis including both steady-state and time domain transient. ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code Analyses Methods Kinematics and Rigid Body Dynamics Familiarity with grid generation and meshing techniques (Ansys CAE, Femap, Hypermesh) Personable attitude with an ability to work well with clients and other staff Bachelor's degree in engineering required; master's degree considered a plus Helpful Qualifications/Non-requirements: ANSYS programming skills, including GUI customization in J-script and Python Explicit dynamics modeling experience (crash impact, metal forming simulations, etc.) using LS-Dyna, Autodyn, or Abaqus Explicit Ability to use 3-D CAD to modify parts and assemblies (Discovery (preferred), SpaceClaim Direct Modeler (preferred), DM, Solidworks, ProE or Siemens NX ) Practical ANSYS experience manipulating and/or modeling complex 3-D assemblies Academic background or work experience in fluid mechanics and CFD Experience with optimization and DOE methods LF/Maxwell experience Concrete modeling experience a plus. Benefits: Medical insurance 100% paid for by employer (no employee out-of-pocket costs required for the premiums, deductibles, and copays) Dental insurance premiums 100% paid for by employer Vision insurance premiums 100% paid for by employer Short Term Disability Long Term Disability 401k Plan with employer match Limited Flexible Spending Account Life Insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Referral program Tuition reimbursement Bonus plan Pay Range: $80,000 - 130,000 Annually ABOUT THE COMPANY: We have a 35+ year relationship with ANSYS and we are their largest Elite Channel Partner in North America. We provide world-class ANSYS engineering simulation software as well as support, training, consulting and physical testing services. We are headquartered in Rochester, NY with additional offices in Cleveland, Seattle, Montreal, and Toronto. We also have remote sales and engineering personnel throughout North America. SimuTech Group employs over 140 people with nearly half being engineers; most holding Master's or PhD degrees. SimuTech Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Job Description: Senior Electrical Engineer – Wastewater/Water Treatment – Los Angeles Opportunity : Parsons is currently seeking a Senior Electrical Engineer to be based in our Los Angeles region, with experience in medium and low voltage power distribution , lighting, grounding, and/or facility systems, and in the preparation of contract documents. The Senior Electrical Engineer will perform a variety of engineering tasks by applying standard engineering techniques and analyses within their discipline. Electrical engineers at this level have experience and an increasing proficiency in the utilization of engineering theories and practices, and Company procedures and quality standards. Typical project assignments are larger in scope and involve engineering calculations, specification development, report generation, BIM (building information modeling), CAE (computer aided engineering), and/or CAD (computer aided design) applications. Work will involve engineering and design of both new facilities and rehabilitating existing facilities. Willingness to travel to supplier, client, and construction site locations is expected. This role allows for remote or hybrid remote based work in California State. Hybrid remote working on a 9/80 schedule ( every other Friday off) is offered. Responsibilities : · Licensed Electrical Engineer in the State of California is desirable · Good knowledge of the wastewater treatment environment and the nature of design related thereto. · Good knowledge of the wastewater treatment environment and the nature of construction related thereto. · Specific knowledge in the areas of: Design of substations, main power distribution, and motor control centers (including layout, transformer sizing, automatic transfer switch sizing, bus sizing, breaker sizing and single line diagram preparation); design of control systems including ladder diagrams; sizing wire and conduit; facility layout of wire and conduit; design and layout of duct banks and pull boxes; Design and layout of lighting and receptacle systems including panelboard schedules and reflective ceiling plans; and preparation of point to point wiring diagrams. · Working knowledge of various processes such as: headworks, primary clarifiers, aeration basins, secondary clarifiers, disinfection processes, anaerobic digestion, reverse osmosis, membrane bioreactors, solids dewatering and other membrane processes. · Knowledge and applications of industry code and standards like NEC, NFPA, etc. · Ability to perform short circuit calculations and protective device coordination studies utilizing ETAP software. · Ability to conduct independent field investigations and collect field data to support design work. · Ability to write specifications. · Ability to anticipate problems and develop solutions to overcome problems. · Ability to respond to contractor’s request for information during construction of facility, verify that equipment meets design specifications, and prepare design changes, review NETA test results, and perform electrical system startup and commissioning for low and medium-voltage systems. · Good communication skills, both written and oral. · Working knowledge of AutoCAD and/or Revit · Good understanding of safety issues including Cal OSHA regulations. Requirements : 4-year degree in Electrical Engineering and 8 years or more of related work experience with power distribution and lighting experience. (PE) registration in the State of California is required, or ability to obtain one within 6 months of hire. A solid experience with Revit, ETAP, and understanding of NEC Codes is essential In addition to the above credentials, experience with municipal wastewater or industrial water treatment system is essential. Experience in the use of off-the-shelf software for calculations and design is required. Experience in the design and specification of a wide variety of electrical systems is preferred. Electrical systems should include one or more of the following: power distribution, panel load calculations, lighting design, emergency power systems, switchgear, transformer selection, and other related systems such as grounding and lightning protection. Candidate shall be capable of working in a self-directed manner with minimal oversight. Candidate should have experience supervising a design group of CAD Designer/Drafters, Designers, and lower-level Engineers in the production of multiple projects or sub-tasks simultaneously. Further experience in any of the following specialty areas is beneficial but not required: communications systems, Fire Alarm, Traction Power, utility relocation and distribution, building management systems, and/or supervisory control and data acquisition. Skills / Competencies : Knowledge of AC and DC electrical power distribution design principles and associated calculations, specification development, and report development is required. Ability to utilize standard office automation software is expected. Ability to communicate verbally and in writing with management, client, and other stakeholders. Working knowledge of REVIT, AutoCAD, MicroStation, MathCAD, lighting design, and/or other software packages typically associated with engineering is beneficial. Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Not Applicable/None  This position is part of our Critical Infrastructure team.  For more than 75 years, our experts have designed and delivered the critical infrastructure that connects and protects communities around the world. We work in diverse, collaborative teams, both within the company and with our partners and customers, to plan, design, build, and modernize infrastructure. We take special pride in projects and solutions that improve communities as well as people’s quality of life by promoting economic growth, enhancing mobility, and increasing sustainability and resiliency. Powered by our people, we provide the imagination necessary to support our customers’ visions—and to help them see new possibilities.  Salary Range: $81,500.00 - $161,400.00  We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!  The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates. Position Summary: Plans and conducts independent work within a global business unit requiring judgment in the evaluation, selection, application and adaptation of engineering techniques, procedures and criteria. Devises new approaches to solving problems. Responsibilities: Plans, schedules, conducts, and coordinates detailed phases of engineering work for a global business unit usually in one discipline in a project or staff group. Performs work that involves conventional engineering practice but may include complex features such as resolving conflicting design requirements, unsuitability of conventional materials and/or difficult coordination requirements. Performs work using Bechtel Standard Application Programs (BSAPs) and appropriate 2-D and 3-D computer aided design and computer aided engineering (CAD and CAE) tools. Plans, coordinates or prepares equipment or work specifications, bid evaluations and award recommendations for equipment. Coordinates engineering efforts in assigned areas between specialty and other engineering groups or disciplines, with the client, suppliers, and contractors and between other groups. Coordinate technical issues with other departments on projects including constructability requirements and reviews. Plans and coordinates independent work requiring judgment and experience in the application and substantial adaptation of engineering techniques. Devises new approaches to technical problems. When delegated, assumes a lead technical role over other engineers or project subgroups for completing specific tasks. Assists in on-the-job-training of assigned personnel and provides input for their performance evaluations. Prepares letters to vendors and clients. Reviews bid analyses and makes recommendation. Prepares or assists in preparation of conceptual studies, designs, reports or proposals. Performs or assists in the performance of problem analysis and original design. Prepares and/or assists in the preparation of cost estimates, quantity take-offs and staffing requirements for proposals, forecasts and change orders. Reviews and checks work of subordinate engineers. Supports the creation of a work environment that fosters openness, trust, communication, teamwork, empowerment, innovation, and satisfaction. Job Knowledge: Thorough knowledge of discipline engineering techniques, the design of engineered systems, and engineering and design calculations. Understands the application of Engineering Department Procedures, relevant Bechtel design guides. Broad knowledge of the application of engineering to plant constructability as applied to construction methods and materials. Knowledge of current computer applications for engineering and design including appropriate knowledge of CAD (both 2-D and 3-D), CAE and relevant Bechtel Standard Computer Applications to perform the work. Understanding of engineering planning and control methods including computerized methods. Understanding of the roles played by other departments on projects including basic construction practices and the economics involved. Understanding of industry or regulatory codes and standards and design criteria pertinent to the particular engineering discipline. Skill in oral and written communication. Job Dimensions: Supervision Received: Performs most assignments independently with instructions as to the general results expected. Receives technical guidance from Engineering Specialists or Supervisors on unusual or complex problems and supervisory approval on proposed project plans. Supervision Exercised: Provides technical direction and assigns work to subordinate engineers, designers, drafters, technicians and others who assist in performing specific assignments. Contacts: Independently contacts vendor's representatives and project field personnel to gather or give information. Contacts client counterparts as directed. Qualifications and Skills: Basic Qualifications: BS degree in structural engineering from an accredited university or college (or international equivalent) with minimum 7 years of progressive relevant experience. Ability to independently execute the detailed design of complex steel and/or concrete structures. Thorough knowledge and application of the AISC Steel Construction Manual, ACI 318, and ASCE 7. A professional Engineering (PE) or Engineer-In-Training (EIT) license from a recognized licensing board. Sufficient number of specialized courses in relevant general engineering or appropriate engineering disciplines to meet job requirements. Practical work experience in design engineering or relevant equivalent experience in allied types of engineering sufficient to demonstrate competence as a trained engineer. Additional Qualifications: Broad working knowledge of precedents in the specialty area, the principles and practices of related technical areas and of coordinating work with other technical disciplines. Knowledgeable of and performs standard discipline engineering activities on projects of relatively small size and complexity within the business line with minimal technical oversight. Broad knowledge of precedents in the industry. Preferred Qualifications: A professional license in an appropriate engineering discipline from a recognized licensing board. Are you someone that has a passion for providing innovated solutions to complex challenges? Do you want to work someplace where creativity and new ideas are encouraged? If so, then keep reading. We fuse technology and engineering to provide product development solutions to customers in a diverse range of industries. Widely recognized for providing engineering, testing, prototype, and manufacturing services to the transportation industry, Roush also provides significant support to the aerospace, defense and theme park industries. With over 2,400 employees in facilities throughout the United States, Europe, Asia, and South America, our unique combination of creativity and tenacity activates big ideas on a global stage. Job Summary: The Senior Electrical Engineer will apply expertise of engineering principles and best practices in the design and development of electrical and electronic projects in various industries such as automotive, aerospace, military, and industrial equipment. The role will assign and define circuit options, harness in-lines, and connector numbers to the system logical schematics and will lead electrical system compatibility reviews. The Senior Electrical Engineer will provide guidance, coaching, and technical support to team members. This position is located in Allen Park, MI. Hybrid work schedule available. Click here to learn more about working at Roush as a Senior Electrical Engineer! As Senior Electrical Engineer, you will: Assign and define circuit options, harness in-lines and connector numbers to the system logical schematics as well as select fuse, wire, and terminal sizing based on application requirements Lead electrical system compatibility reviews and sign-off wire harness prints Integrate wire harnesses, connectors, sensors, switches, and electrical components into overall vehicle architecture Develop wire harness architecture, routing, physical schematics and power distribution for electrical system requirements, logical design data and perform design rule checks Identify and mitigate major electrical system failure modes and effects Provide leadership, guidance, coaching, and technical support to team members Act as a liaison with program team, CAE analysis group, suppliers, and assembly for all design responsible parts Develop and implement processes that deliver quality and timely product Participate in programs, team meetings and training Minimum qualifications to be considered: Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering Minimum 6 years of experience in vehicle electronics, electrical controls and wire packaging Experience conducting presentations and management reviews Experience with development and maintenance of Design Verification Plan & Reports/Failure Mode and Effects Analyses (DVP&R/DFMEA) Knowledge of Controller Area Network (CAN) bus protocol Knowledge of wire harness design tools Ability to work in a team environment and collaborate with others Excellent presentation skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills A successful candidate may also have: Knowledge of Mentor Graphics and Zuken Military experience Our full-time benefits include: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, earned sick time, STD, LTD, 401K, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation, paid holidays, and more. If you share our passion for providing innovative solutions to complex challenges, we want you on our team. Please visit our careers page and apply by clicking on this link: https://jobs.roush.com/us/en/ Visit our website: www.roush.com Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/RoushCareers Roush is an EO employer – Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories If you need a reasonable accommodation for our employment application process due to disability, please contact Roush Talent Acquisition at 734-779-7087.

Requisition ID: 270591 Location: Houston, TX Relocation Authorized: National - Family Telework Type: Part-Time Telework Other Requirements: Pre-employment drug screen and background check Company Overview Since 1898, we have helped customers complete more than 25,000 projects in 160 countries on all seven continents that have created jobs, grown economies, improved the resiliency of the world's infrastructure, increased access to energy, resources, and vital services, and made the world a safer, cleaner place. Differentiated by the quality of our people and our relentless drive to deliver the most successful outcomes, we align our capabilities to our customers’ objectives to create a lasting positive impact. We serve the Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; Mining & Metals, and the Manufacturing and Technology markets. Our services span from initial planning and investment, through start-up and operations. Core to Bechtel is our values – ethics, safety, quality, people, culture, relationships, innovation and sustainability, and our covenants – integrity, respect, collaboration, trust, and delivery. They are what we believe, what customers can expect, and how we deliver. Responsibilities Plans, schedules and conducts independent work in the evaluation, selection, application and adaptation of engineering techniques, procedures and criteria in one discipline in a project or staff group. Coordinates detailed phases of engineering work requiring judgment in the application of techniques. Performs work that involves conventional engineering practice but may include complex features such as resolving conflicting design requirements, unsuitability of conventional materials and/or difficult coordination requirements. Performs work using standard application programs and appropriate 2-D and 3-D computer-aided design and computer-aided engineering (CAD and CAE) tools. Plans, coordinates or prepares equipment or work specifications, bid evaluations and award recommendations for equipment. Prepares and/or assists in the preparation of cost estimates, quantity take-offs and staffing requirements for proposals, forecasts and change orders. Reviews bid analyses and makes recommendations. Prepares or assists in preparation of conceptual studies, designs, reports or proposals. Performs or assists in the performance of problem analysis and original design and normally uses conventional approaches to solving technical problems encountered. Coordinates engineering efforts in assigned areas between specialty and other engineering groups or disciplines with the client, suppliers, and contractors and between other groups to gather or give information. Provides technical direction and assigns work to subordinate engineers, designers, drafters, technicians and others who assist in performing specific assignments. Plans and conducts independent work within a Global Business Unit that requires judgment in evaluating, selecting, applying, and adapting engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria. Devises new approaches to solving problems. Manages the work of a small group of engineers. Qualifications and Skills Basic Qualification A recognized degree in a job-related engineering or scientific discipline from an accredited college or university. Practical work experience in design engineering or relevant equivalent experience in all types of engineering is sufficient to demonstrate competence as a trained engineer. Thorough knowledge of discipline engineering techniques, the design of engineered systems, and engineering and design calculations. Understanding of industry or regulatory codes and standards and design criteria pertinent to the particular engineering discipline. Broad knowledge of the application of engineering to plant constructability as applied to construction methods and materials. Understands the standard engineering work planning, scheduling and cost estimating. Knowledge of current computer applications for engineering and design including appropriate knowledge of CAD (both 2-D and 3-D) and CAE and relevant standard computer applications to perform the work. Understanding of engineering planning and control methods including computerized methods. Understanding of the roles played by other departments on projects including basic construction practices and the economics involved. Working knowledge of precedents in the specialty area, the principles and practices of related technical areas and of coordinating work with other technical disciplines. Skill in oral and written communication. Preferred Qualifications Specific experience in planning and executing greenfield or brownfield projects in one or more of the following market segments: Natural gas processing including liquefaction and regasification. Coal, gas or biomass to chemicals such as methanol and ammonia. Petrochemicals Carbon capture and sequestration. Solar and/or combined cycle power plants. Hydrogen value chain including electrolysis, reforming, liquefaction, transportation and fueling stations. Offshore and onshore pipelines. Desalination, raw water, demineralized water and wastewater treatment plants. Familiarity with current process technologies and licensors associated with the above. Additional Qualifications E.I.T. / F.E. Certification is preferred. Registration as Professional Engineer is strongly preferred. ETAP calculation experience is strongly preferred. Previous experience on FEEDs or Project Proposals is strongly preferred. Previous experience preparing estimated quantities, jobhour estimates, and schedule planning is strongly preferred. Ability to develop innovative ideas to reduce project total installed costs (TIC). Ability to present technical design issues to the customer and supplier and the ability to recommend solutions based on knowledge and experience. Demonstrated depth & breadth of technical competency in at least one of the following subjects: Gas Insulated Switchgear, High Voltage Installations, Customer Owned High Voltage Transmission Lines, Prefabricated Substations, Electrical System Design and Analysis, Electrical Calculations (Load Flow, Motor Starting, Short Circuit, Harmonic Analysis, Transient Stability, Relay Coordination, Arc Flash), Protective Relaying, Power Management Systems, Power Transformers, High Power Adjustable Speed Drive Systems, Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS), PV/Wind Energy, Microgrid Systems, etc. Shaping tomorrow together Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; and Mining & Metals. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. These values are what we believe, what we expect, what we deliver, and what we live. www.bechtel.com Bechtel is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, citizenship status (except as authorized by law), protected veteran status, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In accordance with Bechtel's duty to provide and maintain a safe workplace for our employees and to safeguard the health of our families, customers, and visitors, we have adopted mandatory COVID-19 safety protocols for each work location, which may include a vaccination or testing requirement. Please speak with your Bechtel recruiter to determine which protocols apply to the work location for the job you are seeking.

column7: Responsibilities: Design complex RF and Microwave components, circuits, systems, and printed circuit boards, utilizing design software tools such as CAE and CAD. Devote a significant portion of time in developing necessary electrical engineering system and testing and analyzing its acquisition system performance. Design and develop phase locked loop circuits and synthesizers and VCO’s (voltage controlled oscillators). Research and design fractional-N fast-switching synthesizers, write test software and procedures for the test equipment to test the fractional-N synthesizers. Utilize personal initiative, maintain both formal and informal technical training, and focus on developing the next test equipment generation based on the latest available electrical technologies. Possess proficient electrical engineering and/or electronic engineering skills along with a body of highly-specialized knowledge that will be applied to contributing to existing technical information. Use integration protocols and methodologies to ensure that SMC’s integration design protocols do not become obsolete, given the rapid technological advances in the field. Utilize sound knowledge of CAD methods and hands-on experience in all synthesizer related fields (CAD, PCB, detail circuits, relevant programming). Perform circuit and component analysis and simulations using industry ADS, HFSS and other CAD tools. Identify and establish performance standards and verify and validate designs through simulations, tests and reliability studies.Qualifications:Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering plus two years of engineering experience. Require expertise in using Software: LabVIEW, TestStand, XML, XPath, Version One, ClearCase, ClearQuest. Must have proof of legal authority to work in the United States. If you are interested and qualified for this position, you can send us a copy of your resume via e-mail, mail or fax. Resumes sent through E-mail must be in MS Word or PDF format.E-mail: hrd@synergymwave.com  Fax : (973) 881-8361  Mailing Address:  Synergy Microwave Corporation  201 McLean Blvd., Paterson, NJ 07504

Job Summary    The Mechanical Design Engineer will be based in Fremont, CA. Nextracker seeks a creative and experienced Mechanical Engineer for a position on the design engineering team. This engineer will be responsible for designing components in order for Nextracker Gemini to support a wider range of modules, more difficult site conditions, and cost reduction.    Watch      this video   to learn why Nextracker is more than just a place to work.    Here is a glimpse of what you’ll do:  Contribute to the design and development of the next generations of Nextracker horizontal tracking products Perform and manage engineering work using CAD/CAE software to solve problems in mechanical/structural design, finite element analysis, design optimization, prototype generation (such as stereo lithography on NC machining), fatigue analysis, structural dynamics and kinematics, vibrations, thermal analysis, production of manufacturing drawings, and plastic part design Develop testing fixtures that accurately simulate real world scenarios Perform and document engineering tests under general supervision Write proposals, technical reports and papers Participate in brainstorming sessions with the mechanical engineering team to identify concepts and designs for future products Develop and maintain best practices to foster the creative process Design mechanical components, execute prototyping, and manage design iterations Implement continuous improvement in order to maximize efficiency in the design process Partner with the Manufacturing Engineer on design for manufacturability to address questions and issues.   Here is some of what you’ll need (required):  B.S. or M.S. degree in Mechanical Engineering, Structural Engineering or a related field (advanced degree preferred) 8 years of experience Toolsets required: SolidWorks, ePDM, FEA, Ansys Extensive knowledge/experience with drawings, model and GD&T standards and application. Hands on experience with shop tools such as chop saw, band saw, grinders, wrenches, etc. Strong understanding of DFM for castings and sheet metal stampings Strong aptitude and intuition in mechanical failure analysis Practical knowledge of prototyping manufacturing process Must possess solid written and verbal communication skills Ability to prioritize and juggle multiple projects Self-motivated team player Ability to work within a cross-functional team while maintaining self-sufficiency Proficient in most common PC based applications (Word, Excel, Visio, PPT, MSProject, and the like) Willingness to travel and work at client sites both domestically and internationally   Here are a few of our preferred experiences:  Experience with Solar or renewable energy Management experience Labview, MATLAB Netsuite, Arena, Miro (Real Time board), Jira, Confluence Python or other coding Automation experience   Nextracker is an Equal Opportunity Employer and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate based on: age, race, religion, color, sex, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, pregnancy status, or any other status protected by law. We're happy to provide reasonable accommodations to those with a disability for assistance in the recruitment process. Please advise us of any accommodations you may need by e-mailing:      accessibility@flex.com  .  Pay Range (Applicable to California)  $87,700.00 USD - $120,600.00 USD Annual    Job Category  Design, Process & Technology Engineering  Relocation: Not eligible    Is Sponsorship Available?  No

Description:  Purpose of this Job: This role is responsible for promoting SANDEN electric compressor product to OEM customers towards new business acquisitions. This role also ensures SANDEN product development meets OEM technical requirements and program milestones. Principle Duties/Essential Functions:Lead new business acquisition by coordinating internal activities with cross-functional teams, and work with OEM customers to ensure customer satisfaction.Lead internal / external review meetings for product development, industrialization and quality.Ensure successful compressor applications in NA market. Drive DFMEA, ADVPR and DRBFM reviews and executions.Ensure meeting customer technical requirements, program milestones and smooth product launch.Research on technology trends and voice of customer and provide feedback to R&D team.Develop and nurture technical relationships with OEM customers. Other Tasks/Responsibilities:Achieves departmental strategic plans and goalsRecommends innovative product features for next generation product designDevelops and evaluates new technologiesEstablishes and achieves technical goals and task utilizing Plan/Do/Check/Action (PDCA) tool for product developmentCoaches / mentors / trains other engineers and staff members.Lead to close technical issues and implement design changes as needed.Establish technical presentation material and present to customers as needed.Secure accuracy of engineering data for internal and external customers.Represent and promote Sanden in SAE and other trade shows.Other projects as assigned by management. Requirements:  Education:Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering (BSEE preferred)Masters’ Degree in Engineering preferred Knowledge, Skills and Experience: 7 to 10 years’ experience in automotive electrical compressor inverter / motor design & control software /hardware development & applications, vehicle & compressor testing & diagnostics, including expert knowledge on CAN / LIN communication and AutoSAR architecture Working knowledge of electric vehicle thermal management system Working knowledge of mechanical compressors, especially scroll compressors Working knowledge of current computer technology and applications such as CAE and MS Office applications Excellent communication and presentation skills with internal and external customers Knowledgeable of ISO-9001, ISO-14001 and IATF procedures Licenses or Certifications:EPA-608 desiredEPA-609 desired Physical Demands: Routine lifting of 25 lb. compressors may be necessary Possible exposure to high noise levels Possible exposure to chemicals (oils, refrigerants, solvents) Ability to work effectively under pressure and be able to prioritize workloads Personal Protective Equipment (PPE):Employee must regularly wear safety glasses, safety shoes and hearing protectionOther PPE may be required based on specific projects Work Environment/Hours:Primary work area is located in an office settingMust work normal office hours plus provide support on evenings and weekend (as needed) Primary Work Location:Plymouth, MI Travel Requirements:10% domestic0% international

Job Description: Senior Electrical Engineer – Wastewater/Water Treatment – Los Angeles Opportunity : Parsons is currently seeking a Senior Electrical Engineer to be based in our Los Angeles region, with experience in medium and low voltage power distribution , lighting, grounding, and/or facility systems, and in the preparation of contract documents. The Senior Electrical Engineer will perform a variety of engineering tasks by applying standard engineering techniques and analyses within their discipline. Electrical engineers at this level have experience and an increasing proficiency in the utilization of engineering theories and practices, and Company procedures and quality standards. Typical project assignments are larger in scope and involve engineering calculations, specification development, report generation, BIM (building information modeling), CAE (computer aided engineering), and/or CAD (computer aided design) applications. Work will involve engineering and design of both new facilities and rehabilitating existing facilities. Willingness to travel to supplier, client, and construction site locations is expected. This role allows for remote or hybrid remote based work in California State. Hybrid remote working on a 9/80 schedule ( every other Friday off) is offered. Responsibilities : · Licensed Electrical Engineer in the State of California is desirable · Good knowledge of the wastewater treatment environment and the nature of design related thereto. · Good knowledge of the wastewater treatment environment and the nature of construction related thereto. · Specific knowledge in the areas of: Design of substations, main power distribution, and motor control centers (including layout, transformer sizing, automatic transfer switch sizing, bus sizing, breaker sizing and single line diagram preparation); design of control systems including ladder diagrams; sizing wire and conduit; facility layout of wire and conduit; design and layout of duct banks and pull boxes; Design and layout of lighting and receptacle systems including panelboard schedules and reflective ceiling plans; and preparation of point to point wiring diagrams. · Working knowledge of various processes such as: headworks, primary clarifiers, aeration basins, secondary clarifiers, disinfection processes, anaerobic digestion, reverse osmosis, membrane bioreactors, solids dewatering and other membrane processes. · Knowledge and applications of industry code and standards like NEC, NFPA, etc. · Ability to perform short circuit calculations and protective device coordination studies utilizing ETAP software. · Ability to conduct independent field investigations and collect field data to support design work. · Ability to write specifications. · Ability to anticipate problems and develop solutions to overcome problems. · Ability to respond to contractor’s request for information during construction of facility, verify that equipment meets design specifications, and prepare design changes, review NETA test results, and perform electrical system startup and commissioning for low and medium-voltage systems. · Good communication skills, both written and oral. · Working knowledge of AutoCAD and/or Revit · Good understanding of safety issues including Cal OSHA regulations. Requirements : 4-year degree in Electrical Engineering and 8 years or more of related work experience with power distribution and lighting experience. (PE) registration in the State of California is required, or ability to obtain one within 6 months of hire. A solid experience with Revit, ETAP, and understanding of NEC Codes is essential In addition to the above credentials, experience with municipal wastewater or industrial water treatment system is essential. Experience in the use of off-the-shelf software for calculations and design is required. Experience in the design and specification of a wide variety of electrical systems is preferred. Electrical systems should include one or more of the following: power distribution, panel load calculations, lighting design, emergency power systems, switchgear, transformer selection, and other related systems such as grounding and lightning protection. Candidate shall be capable of working in a self-directed manner with minimal oversight. Candidate should have experience supervising a design group of CAD Designer/Drafters, Designers, and lower-level Engineers in the production of multiple projects or sub-tasks simultaneously. Further experience in any of the following specialty areas is beneficial but not required: communications systems, Fire Alarm, Traction Power, utility relocation and distribution, building management systems, and/or supervisory control and data acquisition. Skills / Competencies : Knowledge of AC and DC electrical power distribution design principles and associated calculations, specification development, and report development is required. Ability to utilize standard office automation software is expected. Ability to communicate verbally and in writing with management, client, and other stakeholders. Working knowledge of REVIT, AutoCAD, MicroStation, MathCAD, lighting design, and/or other software packages typically associated with engineering is beneficial. Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Not Applicable/None  This position is part of our Critical Infrastructure team.  For more than 75 years, our experts have designed and delivered the critical infrastructure that connects and protects communities around the world. We work in diverse, collaborative teams, both within the company and with our partners and customers, to plan, design, build, and modernize infrastructure. We take special pride in projects and solutions that improve communities as well as people’s quality of life by promoting economic growth, enhancing mobility, and increasing sustainability and resiliency. Powered by our people, we provide the imagination necessary to support our customers’ visions—and to help them see new possibilities.  Salary Range: $81,500.00 - $161,400.00  We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!  The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates. Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.  We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

We heard you knock!Masonite is a leading global designer, manufacturer, marketer and distributor Residential and Commercial doors, high-performance door frames and door system components for the new construction as well as repair, renovation, and remodeling sectors. Since 1925, it has provided its customers with innovative products and superior service at compelling values. As a pioneering door manufacturer catering to both residential and commercial markets, it is embarking on an exciting venture by investing in consumer driven innovation to deliver on its commitment of Doors That Do More™ strategy that addresses human needs for comfort, security, style, and convenience.Product Engineering function within Masonite Innovation Center tackles complex, global product and manufacturing challenges. This position presents a unique opportunity to be part of a rapidly growing team within an industry-leading innovative company and seeks candidates who thrive in a dynamic, start-up-like environment – Inspiring/guiding multidisciplinary team, driving innovation and efficiency in product development process.As Subject-Matter Expert and Technical/scientist partner to VP of Product Engineering, this role is crucial in providing Technology Leadership for new product development/engineering of interior/exterior doors, door-frames, systems and components, manufacturing procedures and process development. Leveraging strategic partnerships with external collaborators/suppliers as well as internal partners, the senior staff engineer is expected to lead front-end innovation, new product development, as well as drive operational excellence while staying stays abreast of new technology, code/compliance requirements, novel materials, process innovation including leading the implementation of best-in-class engineering practices.Responsibilities:Accountable for leading and delivering on strategic business initiatives viz., Innovation, Growth, Sustaining/Operational Excellence across Interior/Exterior Doors, Door-Systems and Components including Value-capture via IP, Technical reports, EMS documentation.Lead all aspects of the product development lifecycle from ideation to detailed design, specification, analysis, and verification – Product design and engineering, material selection, product performance testing/modeling, manufacturing process assessment, prototyping, VA/VE initiatives as well as competitive assessment.Take a hands-on approach in all facets of systems/components design, including requirements analysis, implementation, integration, and validation – Identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure smooth project execution.Provide technical assistance, develop engineering proposals/project charters and Installation guidelines; As primary interface, partner with Business/Commercial team for customer training demonstrations/presentations to introduce Masonite’s product portfolio and engage directly with customersBe a Role-model/Lead culture of mentoring multi-disciplinary team on project management, product portfolio, technical rigor, scientific methodology and data-driven decisions – Plan, monitor, and control projects to ensure they are completed on time, within budget, and meet high-quality standards.Support Front-End Innovation leveraging demonstrated technology leadership, market and product portfolio knowledge, innovative mind-set, and internal/external network – Promote cross-functional collaboration and create environment that encourages innovative thinking and continuous improvement.Engage broader OEMs/Vendors to understand emerging capabilities and innovative/ differentiated new technologies – Support down-selection of strategic suppliers and partners for delivering world-class solutions.Interface and collaborate with contract manufacturers, universities, test labs, and engineering firms to drive product innovation and scale-up, ensuring timelines, budgets, and quality standards are met.Communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders to keep them informed of progress and manage expectationsPromote Safety culture and Implement Site-Safety initiatives.Minimum Qualifications & Experience Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Material Sci. and/or Industrial or a related field). Advanced degrees (Master's, PhD) are highly desirable.10+ years relevant work experience in Product Development/Engineering, Technology Leadership including managing large cross-functional projects/programs.Demonstrated competence in leading and contributing to the development and engineering of innovative products that deliver significant business growth.Solid hands-on Experience in Prototyping and Specialized Application Development Testing, Installation and Reliability Testing, Benchmarking / Reverse EngineeringProven success in product design and engineering with wood, composites, metals, plastics, fiberglass, coatings, adhesives, sealants and elastomers including their failure modes/design limits.Competent in engineering a product from scratch using sound engineering principles and best practices, taking appropriate material selections and construction designs into consideration.Skilled in crafting engineering documentation (specifications, drawings, test reports). Good knowledge of CAD/CAE tools for product design and engineering (e.g., AutoCAD, Autodesk Inventor, Solidworks, CAE – Thermal/Structural, Matlab etc)Good understanding of relevant manufacturing processes, i.e., injection molding, SMC molding, extrusion, foam injection, lamination/ assembly processes of (wood-composite products)Knowledge of Lean Sigma tools for identification of root causes and proposed solutions within the realm of product engineering aspects – DFMEA/ PFMEA, Lean/ Six Sigma FundamentalsMulti-functional project leadership and communication skills. Ability to mentor/coach technical staffDemonstrable ability to solve complex engineering problems, manage risks, and make effective decisions under pressure.Familiarity with the Internet of Things (IoT) landscape and experience in developing IoT-integrated products would be advantageous. Knowledge/experience of electro-mechanical systems a plusOur BenefitsMedical Plans (HSA Basic, HSA Plus or PPO)Dental, Vision, Life, AD&D InsuranceShort + Long-Term Disability InsurancePaid Parental Leave and Adoption BenefitsEmployee Assistance Program (EAP/Wellness)Paid Holidays401(k) with Company MatchEducational Assistance ProgramVacation TimeAdvancement Opportunities - we promote from within the companyReferral bonusCompany Stock Purchase ProgramThis is a full-time position requiring weekday (Monday - Friday) work onsite at our Innovation Centers in West Chicago, IL with limited flexibility to work from home.
