In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!  When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.  Job Description: You know the pleasure of an organized desktop… and an organized mind As an orderly person, you thrive on structure and handle your daily tasks with focus and professionalism. You keep all of your everyday needs at your fingertips, which spares you the chaos that would put you behind schedule. We prize your talent for efficiency. We couldn’t be the thriving organization we are without sharp, detail-oriented people like you. Please apply. Ready to put your skills to work on Technical or Engineering projects? Are you great with people and have willingness to work hard to get the job done? Parsons is seeking a candidate with a desire to enhance the fabric of our community.   Position Overview:  Completes a wide variety of difficult engineering assignments, applying engineering techniques and analyses within one discipline. The Engineer at this level is a fully qualified professional, proficient in the utilization of most engineering theories and practices. Some assignments involve CAE (computer aided engineering)/CAD (computer aided design) applications. Willingness to travel or relocate to supplier, client, or construction site locations, is expected. Responsible for assessing various Job Corps Centers throughout the United States for compliance with codes and for deficiencies which need to be addressed with capital expenditures. Assesses the electrical components of the buildings including fire alarm systems and lightning protection systems. Writes deficiencies to address all non-compliance issues and writes narrative report to articulate facilities conditions, findings and recommendations. Provides technical reviews for center facilities funding and technical requests. Performs design reviews for assigned renovation and construction projects, and provides technical engineering and facilities support for various Job Corps Centers.   Responsibilities: Performs complex engineering tasks and particularly important engineering work efficiently and accurately. Extracts engineering information from CAD drawings. Prepares engineering computations, material quantity takeoffs, estimates, surveys, and designs. Completes a variety of assignments such as drawings, specifications, and other materials suitable for procurement and construction purposes. Frequently interfaces with other Engineering disciplines as well as other departments. Prepares detailed requisitions for equipment and materials. Reviews supplier drawing submittals and performs technical bid analyses. Prepares and issues specifications, data sheets, and other construction documents. Provides technical guidance to CAD Designer/Drafters, Designers, and lower-level Engineers working on the same project. May be required to provide the seal and signature of the professional engineer, as appropriate, ensuring compliance with all applicable codes, regulations, and ordinances. May act in an advisory capacity to senior management personnel on engineering related matters. Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate. Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (or related field) and typically 8+ years of related work experience. Professional Engineer registration may be required. Proficiency in utilizing CAD and other PC software packages typically associated with engineering is required. Organizations win or lose based on customers’ experiences. Join a winner! We aim for more than customers — we want loyal advocates. We’re a driven bunch, but we love doing it, and our customers can tell that we do. We want to tell you more. Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Not Applicable/None  This position is part of our Federal Solutions team.  Our Federal Solutions segment delivers resources to our US government customers that ensure the success of missions around the globe. Our diverse, intelligent employees drive the state of the art as they provide services and solutions in the areas of defense, security, intelligence, infrastructure, and environmental. We promote a culture of excellence and close-knit teams that take pride in delivering, protecting, and sustaining our nation's most critical assets, from Earth to cyberspace. Throughout the company, our people are anticipating what’s next to deliver the solutions our customers need now.  Salary Range: $39.18 - $77.60  The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates. Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.  We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

We work alongside the best and brightest to do incredibly cool things you wouldn't believe. At Roush, you're part of building the future. Are you someone that has a passion for providing innovated solutions to complex challenges? Do you want to work someplace where creativity and new ideas are encouraged? If so, then keep reading. We fuse technology and engineering to provide product development solutions to customers in a diverse range of industries. Widely recognized for providing engineering, testing, prototype, and manufacturing services to the transportation industry, Roush also provides significant support to the aerospace, defense and theme park industries. With over 2,400 employees in facilities throughout the United States, Europe, Asia, and South America, our unique combination of creativity and tenacity activates big ideas on a global stage. Job Summary: The Senior Electrical Engineer will apply expertise of engineering principles and best practices in the design and development of electrical and electronic projects in various industries such as automotive, aerospace, military, and industrial equipment. The role will assign and define circuit options, harness in-lines, and connector numbers to the system logical schematics and will lead electrical system compatibility reviews. The Senior Electrical Engineer will provide guidance, coaching, and technical support to team members. This position is located in Allen Park, MI. Hybrid work schedule available. Click here to learn more about working at Roush as a Senior Electrical Engineer! As Senior Electrical Engineer, you will: Assign and define circuit options, harness in-lines and connector numbers to the system logical schematics as well as select fuse, wire, and terminal sizing based on application requirements Lead electrical system compatibility reviews and sign-off wire harness prints Integrate wire harnesses, connectors, sensors, switches, and electrical components into overall vehicle architecture Develop wire harness architecture, routing, physical schematics and power distribution for electrical system requirements, logical design data and perform design rule checks Identify and mitigate major electrical system failure modes and effects Provide leadership, guidance, coaching, and technical support to team members Act as a liaison with program team, CAE analysis group, suppliers, and assembly for all design responsible parts Develop and implement processes that deliver quality and timely product Participate in programs, team meetings and training Minimum qualifications to be considered: Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering Minimum 6 years of experience in vehicle electronics, electrical controls and wire packaging Experience conducting presentations and management reviews Experience with development and maintenance of Design Verification Plan & Reports/Failure Mode and Effects Analyses (DVP&R/DFMEA) Knowledge of Controller Area Network (CAN) bus protocol Knowledge of wire harness design tools Ability to work in a team environment and collaborate with others Excellent presentation skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills A successful candidate may also have: Knowledge of Mentor Graphics and Zuken Military experience Our full-time benefits include: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, earned sick time, STD, LTD, 401K, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation, paid holidays, and more. If you share our passion for providing innovative solutions to complex challenges, we want you on our team. Please visit our careers page and apply by clicking on this link: https://jobs.roush.com/us/en/ Visit our website: www.roush.com Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/RoushCareers Roush is an EO employer – Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories If you need a reasonable accommodation for our employment application process due to disability, please contact Roush Talent Acquisition at 734-779-7087.

Requisition ID: 272198 Relocation Authorized: National - Family Telework Type: Part-Time Telework Work Location: Houston, TX Since 1898, we have helped customers complete more than 25,000 projects in 160 countries on all seven continents that have created jobs, grown economies, improved the resiliency of the world's infrastructure, increased access to energy, resources, and vital services, and made the world a safer, cleaner place. Differentiated by the quality of our people and our relentless drive to deliver the most successful outcomes, we align our capabilities to our customers’ objectives to create a lasting positive impact. We serve the Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; Mining & Metals, and the Manufacturing and Technology markets. Our services span from initial planning and investment, through start-up and operations. Core to Bechtel is our values – ethics, safety, quality, people, culture, relationships, innovation and sustainability, and our covenants – integrity, respect, collaboration, trust, and delivery. They are what we believe, what customers can expect, and how we deliver. Bechtel Manufacturing & Technology, Inc. offers engineering, procurement, and construction services for customers in the semiconductor manufacturing, electric vehicle, and data center markets. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, the M&T global business unit also includes colleagues working in Arizona, Ohio, Texas, India, and additional project locations around the world. Position Summary: Plans and conducts independent work within a global business unit requiring judgment in the evaluation, selection, application and adaptation of engineering techniques, procedures and criteria. Devises new approaches to solving problems. Responsibilities: Plans, schedules, conducts, and coordinates detailed phases of engineering work for a global business unit usually in one discipline in a project or staff group. Performs work that involves conventional engineering practice but may include complex features such as resolving conflicting design requirements, unsuitability of conventional materials and/or difficult coordination requirements. Performs work using Bechtel Standard Application Programs (BSAPs) and appropriate 2-D and 3-D computer aided design and computer aided engineering (CAD and CAE) tools. Plans, coordinates or prepares equipment or work specifications, bid evaluations and award recommendations for equipment. Coordinates engineering efforts in assigned areas between specialty and other engineering groups or disciplines, with the client, suppliers, and contractors and between other groups. Coordinate technical issues with other departments on projects including constructability requirements and reviews. Plans and coordinates independent work requiring judgment and experience in the application and substantial adaptation of engineering techniques. Devises new approaches to technical problems. When delegated, assumes a lead technical role over other engineers or project subgroups for completing specific tasks. Assists in on-the-job-training of assigned personnel and provides input for their performance evaluations. Prepares letters to vendors and clients. Reviews bid analyses and makes recommendation. Prepares or assists in preparation of conceptual studies, designs, reports or proposals. Performs or assists in the performance of problem analysis and original design. Prepares and/or assists in the preparation of cost estimates, quantity take-offs and staffing requirements for proposals, forecasts and change orders. Reviews and checks work of subordinate engineers. Supports the creation of a work environment that fosters openness, trust, communication, teamwork, empowerment, innovation, and satisfaction. Job Knowledge: Thorough knowledge of discipline engineering techniques, the design of engineered systems, and engineering and design calculations. Understands the application of Engineering Department Procedures, relevant Bechtel design guides. Broad knowledge of the application of engineering to plant constructability as applied to construction methods and materials. Knowledge of current computer applications for engineering and design including appropriate knowledge of CAD (both 2-D and 3-D), CAE and relevant Bechtel Standard Computer Applications to perform the work. Understanding of engineering planning and control methods including computerized methods. Understanding of the roles played by other departments on projects including basic construction practices and the economics involved. Understanding of industry or regulatory codes and standards and design criteria pertinent to the particular engineering discipline. Skill in oral and written communication. Job Dimensions: Supervision Received: Performs most assignments independently with instructions as to the general results expected. Receives technical guidance from Engineering Specialists or Supervisors on unusual or complex problems and supervisory approval on proposed project plans. Supervision Exercised: Provides technical direction and assigns work to subordinate engineers, designers, drafters, technicians and others who assist in performing specific assignments. Contacts: Independently contacts vendor's representatives and project field personnel to gather or give information. Contacts client counterparts as directed. Qualifications and Skills: Basic Qualifications: BS degree in structural engineering from an accredited university or college (or international equivalent) with minimum 7 years of progressive relevant experience. Ability to independently execute the detailed design of complex steel and/or concrete structures. Thorough knowledge and application of the AISC Steel Construction Manual, ACI 318, and ASCE 7. A professional Engineering (PE) or Engineer-In-Training (EIT) license from a recognized licensing board. Sufficient number of specialized courses in relevant general engineering or appropriate engineering disciplines to meet job requirements. Practical work experience in design engineering or relevant equivalent experience in allied types of engineering sufficient to demonstrate competence as a trained engineer. Additional Qualifications: Broad working knowledge of precedents in the specialty area, the principles and practices of related technical areas and of coordinating work with other technical disciplines. Knowledgeable of and performs standard discipline engineering activities on projects of relatively small size and complexity within the business line with minimal technical oversight. Broad knowledge of precedents in the industry. Preferred Qualifications: A professional license in an appropriate engineering discipline from a recognized licensing board. Specific experience in planning and executing greenfield or brownfield projects in one or more of the following market segments:    Semiconductor Electric Vehicle Battery Data Center #LI-Hybrid #LI-AM3 Shaping tomorrow together Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; and Mining & Metals. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. These values are what we believe, what we expect, what we deliver, and what we live. www.bechtel.com Bechtel is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, citizenship status (except as authorized by law), protected veteran status, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.  Bechtel employees are required to be vaccinated for COVID-19 or show proof of a negative test result prior to accessing Bechtel sites/facilities to the extent required by applicable law or by customer requirements.

Burbank, CA 91504: Paterson, NJ (Eastside Park Historic District area)
column7: Responsibilities: Design complex RF and Microwave components, circuits, systems, and printed circuit boards, utilizing design software tools such as CAE and CAD. Devote a significant portion of time in developing necessary electrical engineering system and testing and analyzing its acquisition system performance. Design and develop phase locked loop circuits and synthesizers and VCO’s (voltage controlled oscillators). Research and design fractional-N fast-switching synthesizers, write test software and procedures for the test equipment to test the fractional-N synthesizers. Utilize personal initiative, maintain both formal and informal technical training, and focus on developing the next test equipment generation based on the latest available electrical technologies. Possess proficient electrical engineering and/or electronic engineering skills along with a body of highly-specialized knowledge that will be applied to contributing to existing technical information. Use integration protocols and methodologies to ensure that SMC’s integration design protocols do not become obsolete, given the rapid technological advances in the field. Utilize sound knowledge of CAD methods and hands-on experience in all synthesizer related fields (CAD, PCB, detail circuits, relevant programming). Perform circuit and component analysis and simulations using industry ADS, HFSS and other CAD tools. Identify and establish performance standards and verify and validate designs through simulations, tests and reliability studies.Qualifications:Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering plus two years of engineering experience. Require expertise in using Software: LabVIEW, TestStand, XML, XPath, Version One, ClearCase, ClearQuest. Must have proof of legal authority to work in the United States. If you are interested and qualified for this position, you can send us a copy of your resume via e-mail, mail or fax. Resumes sent through E-mail must be in MS Word or PDF format.E-mail: hrd@synergymwave.com  Fax : (973) 881-8361  Mailing Address:  Synergy Microwave Corporation  201 McLean Blvd., Paterson, NJ 07504

Description:  Purpose of this Job: This role is responsible for promoting SANDEN electric compressor product to OEM customers towards new business acquisitions. This role also ensures SANDEN product development meets OEM technical requirements and program milestones. Principle Duties/Essential Functions:Lead new business acquisition by coordinating internal activities with cross-functional teams, and work with OEM customers to ensure customer satisfaction.Lead internal / external review meetings for product development, industrialization and quality.Ensure successful compressor applications in NA market. Drive DFMEA, ADVPR and DRBFM reviews and executions.Ensure meeting customer technical requirements, program milestones and smooth product launch.Research on technology trends and voice of customer and provide feedback to R&D team.Develop and nurture technical relationships with OEM customers. Other Tasks/Responsibilities:Achieves departmental strategic plans and goalsRecommends innovative product features for next generation product designDevelops and evaluates new technologiesEstablishes and achieves technical goals and task utilizing Plan/Do/Check/Action (PDCA) tool for product developmentCoaches / mentors / trains other engineers and staff members.Lead to close technical issues and implement design changes as needed.Establish technical presentation material and present to customers as needed.Secure accuracy of engineering data for internal and external customers.Represent and promote Sanden in SAE and other trade shows.Other projects as assigned by management. Requirements:  Education:Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering (BSEE preferred)Masters’ Degree in Engineering preferred Knowledge, Skills and Experience: 7 to 10 years’ experience in automotive electrical compressor inverter / motor design & control software /hardware development & applications, vehicle & compressor testing & diagnostics, including expert knowledge on CAN / LIN communication and AutoSAR architecture Working knowledge of electric vehicle thermal management system Working knowledge of mechanical compressors, especially scroll compressors Working knowledge of current computer technology and applications such as CAE and MS Office applications Excellent communication and presentation skills with internal and external customers Knowledgeable of ISO-9001, ISO-14001 and IATF procedures Licenses or Certifications:EPA-608 desiredEPA-609 desired Physical Demands: Routine lifting of 25 lb. compressors may be necessary Possible exposure to high noise levels Possible exposure to chemicals (oils, refrigerants, solvents) Ability to work effectively under pressure and be able to prioritize workloads Personal Protective Equipment (PPE):Employee must regularly wear safety glasses, safety shoes and hearing protectionOther PPE may be required based on specific projects Work Environment/Hours:Primary work area is located in an office settingMust work normal office hours plus provide support on evenings and weekend (as needed) Primary Work Location:Plymouth, MI Travel Requirements:10% domestic0% international

At SimuTech Group, we truly believe that we are driving innovation and changing the world through the power of engineering simulation. Our growing team of energetic, tech savvy professionals work hard every day to inspire our clients to push the boundaries of innovation and deliver transformational products. If you are motivated and driven by a culture where excellent work ethic and passion are rewarded, then a career with SimuTech Group may be for you! Looking for your next career move? Help today’s engineers build tomorrow’s products by providing solutions and guidance with the power of simulation. We are looking for a Mechanical Engineer with 8 to 10 years of experience to join our world-class FEA Support and Consulting team! This position would be based out of either SimuTech office in Rochester, NY, or Everett, WA. For the right candidate, a remote position can be accommodated elsewhere in the US. The right candidate will become a key member of our technical staff, working in an exciting and challenging technical environment. Success of the Mechanical Engineer will be measured by helping grow SimuTech’s FEA business and developing your own technical skills by solving challenging problems in a wide variety of industries. Each member of our staff is a FEA expert who also maintains expertise in one or more specialized fields. Many of our engineers hold advanced degrees with extensive experience in the engineering consulting business. We maintain a high level of professionalism in a friendly, cooperative, flexible environment. Location: Flexible Essential Job Functions/Accountabilities: The Mechanical Engineer will use software such as ANSYS Mechanical and Mechanical APDL to provide: 1. Technical Support - Provide Support to end users of ANSYS by phone, e-mail, or in person. 2. Pre-sales Support - Work with our account managers to determine the customer's software needs, answer customer technical questions during the sales process and provide software demos/presentations on a variety of subjects. 3. Consulting Work with customers to determine their analysis requirements and expectations. Develop quotes/proposals by determining scopes, costs, and schedules Perform all aspects of analysis (Meshing, Load Cases, Solving, Post Processing, Conclusions) Work with customers to propose alternative design ideas Write analysis reports and other technical documents requested by the customer 4. Technical Training - Teach ANSYS classes at client sites, on-line, and in SimuTech offices across the U.S. and Canada Desired Skills/Experience: Non-Negotiable Hiring Criteria: Must be permanently authorized to work in the US Professional appearance and presentation required. Proficient in Microsoft Office. Must be able to work well in a group and independently. Excellent English-based communication skills, technical writing and verbal skills required. Documented industry experience with enterprise level finite element analysis tools Ansys (preferred). Abacus, Nastran, Altair, etc. Ability to communicate with customers on a technical pre-sales basis to help drive software and services sales Demonstrates creative problem-solving and strong analytical skills Solid theoretical background in structural mechanics and numerical methods backed up by real-world, production-level experience Documented experience (as evidenced by industry experience and/or publications in reputable journals) in:             Structural linear and non-linear static implicit analysis methods (non-linear materials including plasticity and hyper elasticity as well as contact and large strain/large deformation) Implicit dynamics including linear (modal, harmonic, response spectrum, random vibration) and thermal analysis including both steady-state and time domain transient. ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code Analyses Methods Kinematics and Rigid Body Dynamics Familiarity with grid generation and meshing techniques (Ansys CAE, Femap, Hypermesh) Personable attitude with an ability to work well with clients and other staff Bachelor's degree in engineering required; master's degree considered a plus Helpful Qualifications/Non-requirements: ANSYS programming skills, including GUI customization in J-script and Python Explicit dynamics modeling experience (crash impact, metal forming simulations, etc.) using LS-Dyna, Autodyn, or Abaqus Explicit Ability to use 3-D CAD to modify parts and assemblies (Discovery (preferred), SpaceClaim Direct Modeler (preferred), DM, Solidworks, ProE or Siemens NX ) Practical ANSYS experience manipulating and/or modeling complex 3-D assemblies Academic background or work experience in fluid mechanics and CFD Experience with optimization and DOE methods LF/Maxwell experience Concrete modeling experience a plus. Benefits: Medical insurance 100% paid for by employer (no employee out-of-pocket costs required for the premiums, deductibles, and copays) Dental insurance premiums 100% paid for by employer Vision insurance premiums 100% paid for by employer Short Term Disability Long Term Disability 401k Plan with employer match Limited Flexible Spending Account Life Insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Referral program Tuition reimbursement Bonus plan Pay Range: $80,000 - 130,000 Annually ABOUT THE COMPANY: We have a 35+ year relationship with ANSYS and we are their largest Elite Channel Partner in North America. We provide world-class ANSYS engineering simulation software as well as support, training, consulting and physical testing services. We are headquartered in Rochester, NY with additional offices in Cleveland, Seattle, Montreal, and Toronto. We also have remote sales and engineering personnel throughout North America. SimuTech Group employs over 140 people with nearly half being engineers; most holding Master's or PhD degrees. SimuTech Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Job Description: Senior Electrical Engineer – Wastewater/Water Treatment – Los Angeles Opportunity : Parsons is currently seeking a Senior Electrical Engineer to be based in our Los Angeles region, with experience in medium and low voltage power distribution , lighting, grounding, and/or facility systems, and in the preparation of contract documents. The Senior Electrical Engineer will perform a variety of engineering tasks by applying standard engineering techniques and analyses within their discipline. Electrical engineers at this level have experience and an increasing proficiency in the utilization of engineering theories and practices, and Company procedures and quality standards. Typical project assignments are larger in scope and involve engineering calculations, specification development, report generation, BIM (building information modeling), CAE (computer aided engineering), and/or CAD (computer aided design) applications. Work will involve engineering and design of both new facilities and rehabilitating existing facilities. Willingness to travel to supplier, client, and construction site locations is expected. This role allows for remote or hybrid remote based work in California State. Hybrid remote working on a 9/80 schedule ( every other Friday off) is offered. Responsibilities : · Licensed Electrical Engineer in the State of California is desirable · Good knowledge of the wastewater treatment environment and the nature of design related thereto. · Good knowledge of the wastewater treatment environment and the nature of construction related thereto. · Specific knowledge in the areas of: Design of substations, main power distribution, and motor control centers (including layout, transformer sizing, automatic transfer switch sizing, bus sizing, breaker sizing and single line diagram preparation); design of control systems including ladder diagrams; sizing wire and conduit; facility layout of wire and conduit; design and layout of duct banks and pull boxes; Design and layout of lighting and receptacle systems including panelboard schedules and reflective ceiling plans; and preparation of point to point wiring diagrams. · Working knowledge of various processes such as: headworks, primary clarifiers, aeration basins, secondary clarifiers, disinfection processes, anaerobic digestion, reverse osmosis, membrane bioreactors, solids dewatering and other membrane processes. · Knowledge and applications of industry code and standards like NEC, NFPA, etc. · Ability to perform short circuit calculations and protective device coordination studies utilizing ETAP software. · Ability to conduct independent field investigations and collect field data to support design work. · Ability to write specifications. · Ability to anticipate problems and develop solutions to overcome problems. · Ability to respond to contractor’s request for information during construction of facility, verify that equipment meets design specifications, and prepare design changes, review NETA test results, and perform electrical system startup and commissioning for low and medium-voltage systems. · Good communication skills, both written and oral. · Working knowledge of AutoCAD and/or Revit · Good understanding of safety issues including Cal OSHA regulations. Requirements : 4-year degree in Electrical Engineering and 8 years or more of related work experience with power distribution and lighting experience. (PE) registration in the State of California is required, or ability to obtain one within 6 months of hire. A solid experience with Revit, ETAP, and understanding of NEC Codes is essential In addition to the above credentials, experience with municipal wastewater or industrial water treatment system is essential. Experience in the use of off-the-shelf software for calculations and design is required. Experience in the design and specification of a wide variety of electrical systems is preferred. Electrical systems should include one or more of the following: power distribution, panel load calculations, lighting design, emergency power systems, switchgear, transformer selection, and other related systems such as grounding and lightning protection. Candidate shall be capable of working in a self-directed manner with minimal oversight. Candidate should have experience supervising a design group of CAD Designer/Drafters, Designers, and lower-level Engineers in the production of multiple projects or sub-tasks simultaneously. Further experience in any of the following specialty areas is beneficial but not required: communications systems, Fire Alarm, Traction Power, utility relocation and distribution, building management systems, and/or supervisory control and data acquisition. Skills / Competencies : Knowledge of AC and DC electrical power distribution design principles and associated calculations, specification development, and report development is required. Ability to utilize standard office automation software is expected. Ability to communicate verbally and in writing with management, client, and other stakeholders. Working knowledge of REVIT, AutoCAD, MicroStation, MathCAD, lighting design, and/or other software packages typically associated with engineering is beneficial. Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Not Applicable/None  This position is part of our Critical Infrastructure team.  For more than 75 years, our experts have designed and delivered the critical infrastructure that connects and protects communities around the world. We work in diverse, collaborative teams, both within the company and with our partners and customers, to plan, design, build, and modernize infrastructure. We take special pride in projects and solutions that improve communities as well as people’s quality of life by promoting economic growth, enhancing mobility, and increasing sustainability and resiliency. Powered by our people, we provide the imagination necessary to support our customers’ visions—and to help them see new possibilities.  Salary Range: $81,500.00 - $161,400.00  We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!  The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates. Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.  We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

We heard you knock!Masonite is a leading global designer, manufacturer, marketer and distributor Residential and Commercial doors, high-performance door frames and door system components for the new construction as well as repair, renovation, and remodeling sectors. Since 1925, it has provided its customers with innovative products and superior service at compelling values. As a pioneering door manufacturer catering to both residential and commercial markets, it is embarking on an exciting venture by investing in consumer driven innovation to deliver on its commitment of Doors That Do More™ strategy that addresses human needs for comfort, security, style, and convenience.Product Engineering function within Masonite Innovation Center tackles complex, global product and manufacturing challenges. This position presents a unique opportunity to be part of a rapidly growing team within an industry-leading innovative company and seeks candidates who thrive in a dynamic, start-up-like environment – Inspiring/guiding multidisciplinary team, driving innovation and efficiency in product development process.As Subject-Matter Expert and Technical/scientist partner to VP of Product Engineering, this role is crucial in providing Technology Leadership for new product development/engineering of interior/exterior doors, door-frames, systems and components, manufacturing procedures and process development. Leveraging strategic partnerships with external collaborators/suppliers as well as internal partners, the senior staff engineer is expected to lead front-end innovation, new product development, as well as drive operational excellence while staying stays abreast of new technology, code/compliance requirements, novel materials, process innovation including leading the implementation of best-in-class engineering practices.Responsibilities:Accountable for leading and delivering on strategic business initiatives viz., Innovation, Growth, Sustaining/Operational Excellence across Interior/Exterior Doors, Door-Systems and Components including Value-capture via IP, Technical reports, EMS documentation.Lead all aspects of the product development lifecycle from ideation to detailed design, specification, analysis, and verification – Product design and engineering, material selection, product performance testing/modeling, manufacturing process assessment, prototyping, VA/VE initiatives as well as competitive assessment.Take a hands-on approach in all facets of systems/components design, including requirements analysis, implementation, integration, and validation – Identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure smooth project execution.Provide technical assistance, develop engineering proposals/project charters and Installation guidelines; As primary interface, partner with Business/Commercial team for customer training demonstrations/presentations to introduce Masonite’s product portfolio and engage directly with customersBe a Role-model/Lead culture of mentoring multi-disciplinary team on project management, product portfolio, technical rigor, scientific methodology and data-driven decisions – Plan, monitor, and control projects to ensure they are completed on time, within budget, and meet high-quality standards.Support Front-End Innovation leveraging demonstrated technology leadership, market and product portfolio knowledge, innovative mind-set, and internal/external network – Promote cross-functional collaboration and create environment that encourages innovative thinking and continuous improvement.Engage broader OEMs/Vendors to understand emerging capabilities and innovative/ differentiated new technologies – Support down-selection of strategic suppliers and partners for delivering world-class solutions.Interface and collaborate with contract manufacturers, universities, test labs, and engineering firms to drive product innovation and scale-up, ensuring timelines, budgets, and quality standards are met.Communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders to keep them informed of progress and manage expectationsPromote Safety culture and Implement Site-Safety initiatives.Minimum Qualifications & Experience Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Material Sci. and/or Industrial or a related field). Advanced degrees (Master's, PhD) are highly desirable.10+ years relevant work experience in Product Development/Engineering, Technology Leadership including managing large cross-functional projects/programs.Demonstrated competence in leading and contributing to the development and engineering of innovative products that deliver significant business growth.Solid hands-on Experience in Prototyping and Specialized Application Development Testing, Installation and Reliability Testing, Benchmarking / Reverse EngineeringProven success in product design and engineering with wood, composites, metals, plastics, fiberglass, coatings, adhesives, sealants and elastomers including their failure modes/design limits.Competent in engineering a product from scratch using sound engineering principles and best practices, taking appropriate material selections and construction designs into consideration.Skilled in crafting engineering documentation (specifications, drawings, test reports). Good knowledge of CAD/CAE tools for product design and engineering (e.g., AutoCAD, Autodesk Inventor, Solidworks, CAE – Thermal/Structural, Matlab etc)Good understanding of relevant manufacturing processes, i.e., injection molding, SMC molding, extrusion, foam injection, lamination/ assembly processes of (wood-composite products)Knowledge of Lean Sigma tools for identification of root causes and proposed solutions within the realm of product engineering aspects – DFMEA/ PFMEA, Lean/ Six Sigma FundamentalsMulti-functional project leadership and communication skills. Ability to mentor/coach technical staffDemonstrable ability to solve complex engineering problems, manage risks, and make effective decisions under pressure.Familiarity with the Internet of Things (IoT) landscape and experience in developing IoT-integrated products would be advantageous. Knowledge/experience of electro-mechanical systems a plusOur BenefitsMedical Plans (HSA Basic, HSA Plus or PPO)Dental, Vision, Life, AD&D InsuranceShort + Long-Term Disability InsurancePaid Parental Leave and Adoption BenefitsEmployee Assistance Program (EAP/Wellness)Paid Holidays401(k) with Company MatchEducational Assistance ProgramVacation TimeAdvancement Opportunities - we promote from within the companyReferral bonusCompany Stock Purchase ProgramThis is a full-time position requiring weekday (Monday - Friday) work onsite at our Innovation Centers in West Chicago, IL with limited flexibility to work from home. This position may require up to 20% domestic travel.#LI-BB1We Help People Walk Through WallsWe respect the privacy of candidates for employment. Description POSTING NO. 832 JOB TITLE: Senior Electrical Engineer DEPT/DIV: M of E WORK LOCATION: Various FULL/PART TIME FULL SALARY RANGE: $118,549 DEADLINE: Open until filled Metro-North Railroad reserves the right to remove this posting prior to the Application Deadline. Opening MTA Metro-North Railroad is a dynamic organization, operating out of the jewel of New York City, Grand Central Terminal. We provide service to over 86.5 million customers, traveling in and out of New York and Connecticut. A subsidiary of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, Metro-North Railroad is one of the busiest commuter railroads in the nation. MTA Metro-North Railroad strives to provide a safe and reliable commute, excellent customer service and rewarding opportunities to its employees. Position Objective Provide Electrical Engineering services to improve and ensure reliability and safety of electrical and mechanical systems on all Metro North Railroad rolling stock and/or facilities assets Responsibilities Provide engineering management and direction to the Equipment Engineering group. Supervise, direct and mentor assigned staff engineers and personnel. Oversee / Provide technical direction on Electrical and Electro-Mechanical Engineering and support for the maintenance, repair, overhaul and modification of all systems in all existing Electric Multiple Unit (EMU), Coach and Locomotive fleets operated by MNR, and MofE facilities assets. Develop and establish maintenance instructions, standards and regulations for repair and modification, maintenance alerts and bulletins, material and equipment procurement and overhaul specifications as required to improve and ensure reliability and safety of all Metro-North Railroad rolling stock. Oversee / Perform new vendor product and component evaluations with MNR Procurement and Material Management and Quality Control Departments. Perform component failure analysis. Devise methods for immediate and long term corrective action. Provide Electrical Engineering and maintenance requirement expertise to MNR Capital Programs Department for existing fleet overhaul, new car design or locomotive procurement. Provide Electrical Engineering interface with other departments and regulatory agencies. Provide engineering support for facilities maintenance and all mechanical systems in MofE facilities, supporting maintenance of equipment and the rolling stocketion. Required Qualifications Strong knowledge of Electro-Multiple Unit (EMU), Coach and Locomotive mechanical and electro-mechanical systems. Possess substantial experience in Propulsion, Auxiliary Power, Event Recorder, Communication, Doors, Lighting and Power Collections systems dynamics and component design. Thorough knowledge of Cab Signal/ATC and ACSES system operation including interface with wayside signals and vehicle operational interfaces. Strong technical, analytical and problem solving skills Ability to lead production and review of Technical & Instructional documentation and correspondence. Working knowledge of micro-processor control diagnostic systems and car borne software as used on rail vehicles Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively with all levels in MN, MTA agencies, federal agencies and outside sourcesFamiliarity with FRA regulations, APTA standards as well as other industry related engineering standards. Strong knowledge of electrical maintenance practices. Strong written and oral communication skillsStrong technical writing skills for development of correspondence, Reports, Procedures and Technical Instructions. Knowledge of standard safety practices rules and regulations in a railroad environment Knowledge in the review and development of drawings, specifications and technical reports. Familiarity with ISO 9000 and Quality Assurance standards and practices. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and/or comparable applications. Strong knowledge of CAD/CAE software application Valid Driver's license Ability to respond to emergency calls on a 24 hour/7 day a week basis Required Education and Experience Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering or related field. Minimum five (5) years of supervisory experience managing technical professionals and/or a diverse unionized workforce. Minimum seven (7) years of experience in an engineering environment and/or equipment manufacturer working on passenger railcars and/or locomotives or related mass transportation equipment. Other Information This is a safety sensitive position and subject to toxicology testing. As an employee of Metro-North Railroad you may be required to complete a New York State financial disclosure statement, if you earn more than $108,638.00 or if you hold a position designated as a policy maker. Employees driving company vehicles must complete defensive driver training once every three years for current MNR drivers; or within 180 days of hire or transfer for an employee entering an authorized driving position. Selection Criteria Due to the competitive nature of the selection process, not all qualified candidates who meet the minimum requirements for the position are guaranteed an interview. To be selected for a position, one must meet the following criteria: (1) satisfy the minimum requirements listed in the job posting, (2) if applicable, successfully pass a written and practical exam, (3) satisfy a background investigation (including but not limited to, employment, education, and criminal history), and (4) pass a verbal interview. Metro-North may also require the applicant to undergo a physical ability test, and, if the Company extends a conditional offer, may require him or her to undergo a medical examination, which may include toxicological testing. Failure to pass any step within the hiring process will result in the disqualification of your application. Additional Criteria for Current Employees: Current Metro-North employees must be in active service to be eligible for consideration. Agreement Employees applying for a position outside of their present craft are required to have worked in your current union for at least one (1) year preceding the Application Deadline to be eligible to apply for a posted position, and have completed the agreed upon formal training commitment, including on-the-job training or lock-in requirement, if applicable (for example: Signal Trainee, Foreman-In-Training, etc.). If you are transferring to another craft, you may be required to forfeit your seniority in your present union. Non-agreement employees must have worked in your current position for a minimum of one (1) year preceding the Application Deadline. Along with a background investigation (including but not limited to, employment, education, and criminal history), employees are also subject to an internal investigation, which includes an evaluation not limited to discipline records and performance assessments. We offer a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package. If interested, please apply online at www.mta.info Based on evaluation of education, skills, experience, and interview. How to Apply MTA employees must apply via My MTA Portal. You can submit an online application by logging into My MTA Portal, clicking the My Job Search ribbon, and selecting the “Careers” link. Logging in through My MTA Portal will link your BSC ID number to your job application to identify you as an internal applicant. Equal Employment Opportunity ALL APPLICANTS MUST APPLY ONLINE TO BE CONSIDERED. METRO-NORTH NO LONGER ACCEPTS HARD COPIES OF RESUMES. Qualified applicants can submit an online application by clicking on the 'APPLY NOW' button from either the CAREERS page or from the JOB DESCRIPTION page.  If you have previously applied online for other positions, enter your Username and Password. If it is your first registration, click on the CLICK HERE TO REGISTER hyperlink and enter a Username and Password; then click on the REGISTER button. When applying for positions, please ensure that you attach a resume during the application process and that you receive a confirmation e-mail that your application was accepted. If you do not receive an email confirmation, your application may not have been received and will not be able to be considered after the deadline date. If you encounter problems, please call the BSC Customer Management Center at (646) 376-0123 Monday through Friday (except MTA-HQ holidays), 8:30am - 5:00pm. EMPLOYEES WHO DO NOT APPLY ONLINE VIA THE INTRANET MAY BE DISQUALIFIED FOR FURTHER CONSIDERATION FOR THIS POSITION. MTA and its subsidiary and affiliated agencies are Equal Opportunity Employers, including with respect to veteran status and individuals with disabilities. The MTA encourages qualified applicants from diverse backgrounds, experiences, and abilities, including military service members, to apply.
